   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Test the behavior of gen_udp. Testing udp is really a very unfunny task,
   23: %% because udp is not deterministic.
   24: %%
   25: %% (cd /mnt/c/$LOCAL_TESTS/26/kernel_test/ && $ERL_TOP/bin/win32/erl.exe -sname kernel-26-tester -pa c:$LOCAL_TESTS/26/test_server)
   26: %% application:set_env(kernel, test_inet_backends, true).
   27: %% S = fun() -> ts:run(kernel, gen_udp_SUITE, [batch]) end.
   28: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, [batch]) end.
   29: %% S = fun() -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_udp_SUITE}]) end.
   30: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}]) end.
   31: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, gen_udp_SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   32: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   33: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_udp_SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   34: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   35: %% T = fun(TC) -> ts:run(kernel, gen_udp_SUITE, TC, [batch]) end.
   36: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_udp_SUITE}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   37: %% T = fun(S, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   38: %% T = fun(S, G, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {group, G}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   39: %%
   40: 
   41: -module(gen_udp_SUITE).
   42: 
   43: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   44: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   45: 
   46: 
   47: %% XXX - we should pick a port that we _know_ is closed. That's pretty hard.
   48: -define(CLOSED_PORT, 6666).
   49: 
   50: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0,
   51:          init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   52: 	 init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2,
   53:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   54: 
   55: -export([
   56: 	 send_to_closed/1, send_to_empty/1, active_n/1,
   57: 	 buffer_size/1, binary_passive_recv/1, max_buffer_size/1, bad_address/1,
   58: 	 read_packets/1, recv_poll_after_active_once/1,
   59:          open_fd/1, connect/1, reconnect/1, implicit_inet6/1,
   60:          recvtos/1, recvtosttl/1, recvttl/1, recvtclass/1,
   61:          sendtos/1, sendtosttl/1, sendttl/1, sendtclass/1,
   62: 	 local_basic/1, local_basic_binary/1, local_unbound/1,
   63: 	 local_fdopen/1, local_fdopen_unbound/1, local_abstract/1,
   64:          recv_close/1,
   65: 	 socket_monitor1/1,
   66: 	 socket_monitor1_manys/1,
   67: 	 socket_monitor1_manyc/1,
   68: 	 socket_monitor1_demon_after/1,
   69: 	 socket_monitor2/1,
   70: 	 socket_monitor2_manys/1,
   71: 	 socket_monitor2_manyc/1,
   72: 	 otp_17492/1,
   73: 
   74:          t_simple_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv/1,
   75:          t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv/1,
   76:          t_simple_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv/1,
   77:          t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv/1,
   78: 
   79:          otp_18323_opts_processing/1,
   80:          otp_18323_open/1,
   81:          otp_19332/1,
   82:          otp_19357_open_with_ipv6_option/1
   83: 	]).
   84: 
   85: -include_lib("kernel/src/inet_int.hrl").
   86: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   87: 
   88: suite() ->
   89:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   90:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   91: 
   92: all() -> 
   93:     %% This is a temporary measure to ensure that we can 
   94:     %% test the socket backend without effecting *all*
   95:     %% applications on *all* machines.
   96:     %% This flag is set only for *one* host.
   97:     case ?TEST_INET_BACKENDS() of
   98:         true ->
   99:             [
  100:              {group, inet_backend_default},
  101:              {group, inet_backend_inet},
  102:              {group, inet_backend_socket}
  103:             ];
  104:         _ ->
  105:             [
  106:              {group, inet_backend_default}
  107:             ]
  108:     end.
  109: 
  110: 
  111: groups() -> 
  112:     [
  113:      {inet_backend_default,   [], inet_backend_default_cases()},
  114:      {inet_backend_inet,      [], inet_backend_inet_cases()},
  115:      {inet_backend_socket,    [], inet_backend_socket_cases()},
  116: 
  117:      {recv_and_send_opts,     [], recv_and_send_opts_cases()},
  118:      {local,                  [], local_cases()},
  119:      {socket_monitor,         [], socket_monitor_cases()},
  120: 
  121:      {sockaddr,               [], sockaddr_cases()},
  122:      {tickets,                [], tickets_cases()},
  123:      {otp18323,               [], otp18323_cases()},
  124:      {otp19332,               [], otp19332_cases()}
  125:     ].
  126: 
  127: inet_backend_default_cases() ->
  128:     all_cases().
  129: 
  130: inet_backend_inet_cases() ->
  131:     all_cases().
  132: 
  133: inet_backend_socket_cases() ->
  134:     all_cases().
  135: 
  136: all_cases() ->
  137:     [
  138:      send_to_closed,
  139:      send_to_empty,
  140:      buffer_size,
  141:      binary_passive_recv,
  142:      max_buffer_size,
  143:      bad_address,
  144:      read_packets,
  145:      recv_poll_after_active_once,
  146:      open_fd,
  147:      connect,
  148:      reconnect,
  149:      implicit_inet6,
  150:      active_n,
  151:      {group, recv_and_send_opts},
  152:      {group, local},
  153:      recv_close,
  154:      {group, socket_monitor},
  155:      otp_17492,
  156:      {group, sockaddr},
  157:      {group, tickets}
  158:     ].
  159: 
  160: recv_and_send_opts_cases() ->
  161:     [
  162:      recvtos, recvtosttl, recvttl, recvtclass,
  163:      sendtos, sendtosttl, sendttl, sendtclass
  164:     ].
  165: 
  166: local_cases() ->
  167:     [
  168:      local_basic,
  169:      local_basic_binary,
  170:      local_unbound,
  171:      local_fdopen,
  172:      local_fdopen_unbound,
  173:      local_abstract
  174:     ].
  175: 
  176: socket_monitor_cases() ->
  177:     [
  178:      socket_monitor1,
  179:      socket_monitor1_manys,
  180:      socket_monitor1_manyc,
  181:      socket_monitor1_demon_after,
  182:      socket_monitor2,
  183:      socket_monitor2_manys,
  184:      socket_monitor2_manyc
  185:     ].
  186: 
  187: sockaddr_cases() ->
  188:     [
  189:      t_simple_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv,
  190:      t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv,
  191:      t_simple_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv,
  192:      t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv
  193:     ].
  194: 
  195: tickets_cases() ->
  196:     [
  197:      {group, otp18323},
  198:      {group, otp19332},
  199:      otp_19357_open_with_ipv6_option
  200:     ].
  201: 
  202: otp18323_cases() ->
  203:     [
  204:      otp_18323_opts_processing,
  205:      otp_18323_open
  206:     ].
  207: 
  208: otp19332_cases() ->
  209:     [
  210:      otp_19332
  211:     ].
  212: 
  213: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  214: 
  215:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  216:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  217:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  218: 
  219:     case ?LIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
  220:         {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  221:             SKIP;
  222: 
  223:         Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  224:             
  225:             %% We need a monitor on this node also
  226:             ?P("init_per_suite -> start (local) system monitor"),
  227:             kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  228: 
  229:             maybe_display_dgram_qlen(),
  230: 
  231:             ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  232:                "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  233: 
  234:             Config1
  235:     end.
  236: 
  237: maybe_display_dgram_qlen() ->
  238:     maybe_display_dgram_qlen(os:type()).
  239: 
  240: maybe_display_dgram_qlen({unix, linux}) ->
  241:     case max_dgram_qlen() of
  242:         QLen when is_integer(QLen) ->
  243:             ?P("Max DGram QLen: ~w~n", [QLen]),
  244:             ok;
  245:         _ ->
  246:             ok
  247:     end;
  248: maybe_display_dgram_qlen(_) ->
  249:     ok.
  250: 
  251: 
  252: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  253: 
  254:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  255:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  256:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  257: 
  258:     %% Stop the local monitor
  259:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  260: 
  261:     Config1 = ?LIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  262: 
  263:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  264:        "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  265: 
  266:     Config1.
  267: 
  268: init_per_group(inet_backend_default = _GroupName, Config) ->
  269:     [{socket_create_opts, []} | Config];
  270: init_per_group(inet_backend_inet = _GroupName, Config) ->
  271:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  272:         true ->
  273:             %% The environment trumps us,
  274:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  275:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  276:         false ->
  277:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, inet}]} | Config]
  278:     end;
  279: init_per_group(inet_backend_socket = _GroupName, Config) ->
  280:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  281:         true ->
  282:             %% The environment trumps us,
  283:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  284:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  285:         false ->
  286:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, socket}]} | Config]
  287:     end;
  288: init_per_group(local, Config) -> 
  289:     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  290:        "is socket supported and is inet-backend = socket ?"),
  291:     case ?LIB:is_socket_supported() andalso ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  292:         true ->
  293:             ?P("init_per_group(local) -> [socket] do we support 'local'?"),
  294:             case ?LIB:has_support_unix_domain_socket() of
  295:                 true ->
  296:                     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> [socket] which platform?"),
  297:                     case os:type() of
  298:                         {win32, _} ->
  299:                             %% AF_LOCAL (AF_UNIX) is *not* (yet) supported
  300:                             %% for DGRAM (UDP) 
  301:                             ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  302:                                "[socket,win32] 'local' not (currently) "
  303:                                "supported for DGRAM on windows"),
  304:                             {skip, "AF_LOCAL not supported"};
  305:                         {OSF, _} ->
  306:                             ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  307:                                "[socket,~w] we support (DGRAM) 'local'!",
  308:                                [OSF]),
  309:                             Config
  310:                     end;
  311:                 false ->
  312:                     {skip, "AF_LOCAL not supported"}
  313:             end;
  314:         false ->
  315:             ?P("init_per_group(local) -> [inet] do we support 'local'?"),
  316:             case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [local]) of
  317:                 {ok,S} ->
  318:                     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  319:                        "[inet] we support (DGRAM) 'local'!"),
  320:                     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
  321:                     Config;
  322:                 {error, eafnosupport} ->
  323:                     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  324:                        "[inet] we *do not* support 'local'"),
  325:                     {skip, "AF_LOCAL not supported"};
  326:                 {error, {invalid, {domain, local}}} ->
  327:                     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  328:                        "[inet] we *do not* support 'local'"),
  329:                     {skip, "AF_LOCAL not supported"}
  330:             end
  331:     end;
  332: init_per_group(sockaddr = _GroupName, Config) ->
  333:     ?P("init_per_group(sockaddr) -> do we support 'socket'"),
  334:     try socket:info() of
  335: 	_ ->
  336:             ?P("init_per_group(sockaddr) -> we support 'socket'"),
  337:             Config
  338:     catch
  339:         error : notsup ->
  340:             ?P("init_per_group(sockaddr) -> we *do not* support 'socket'"),
  341:             {skip, "esock not supported"};
  342:         error : undef ->
  343:             ?P("init_per_group(sockaddr) -> 'socket' not configured"),
  344:             {skip, "esock not configured"}
  345:     end;
  346: init_per_group(otp18323 = _GroupName, Config) ->
  347:     ?P("init_per_group(otp18323) -> inet-drv specific bug(s)"),
  348:     case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  349:         true ->
  350:             {skip, "Inet Drv specific bugs"};
  351:         false ->
  352:             ok
  353:     end;
  354: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  355:     Config.
  356: 
  357: end_per_group(local, _Config) ->
  358:     delete_local_filenames();
  359: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  360:     Config.
  361: 
  362: 
  363: init_per_testcase(Case, Config0) ->
  364:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> entry with"
  365:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  366:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  367:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  368:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  369:        [Config0, erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  370: 
  371:     kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:reset_events(),
  372: 
  373:     Config1 = init_per_testcase2(Case, Config0),
  374: 
  375:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> done when"
  376:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  377:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  378:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  379:     Config1.
  380: 
  381: init_per_testcase2(read_packets, Config) ->
  382:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
  383:     Config;
  384: init_per_testcase2(_Case, Config) ->
  385:     Config.
  386: 
  387: 
  388: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  389:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> entry with"
  390:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  391:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  392:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  393:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  394:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  395: 
  396:     ?P("system events during test: "
  397:        "~n   ~p", [kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:events()]),
  398: 
  399:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> done with"
  400:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  401:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  402:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  403:     ok.
  404: 
  405: 
  406: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  407: %% Send two packets to a closed port (on some systems this causes the socket
  408: %% to be closed).
  409: 
  410: %% Tests core functionality.
  411: send_to_closed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  412:     Pre  = fun() ->
  413:                    Sock = case ?OPEN(Config, 0) of
  414:                               {ok, S} ->
  415:                                   S;
  416:                               {error, OReason} ->
  417:                                   ?P("~w:pre -> Failed create socket: "
  418:                                      "~n   Reason: ~p",
  419:                                      [?FUNCTION_NAME, OReason]),
  420:                                   ?SKIPT(?F("Failed open socket: ~w",
  421:                                             [OReason]))
  422:                           end,
  423:                    case ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet) of
  424:                        {ok, Addr} ->
  425:                            #{socket     => Sock,
  426:                              local_addr => Addr};
  427:                        {error, LReason} ->
  428:                            ?P("Failed get local address: "
  429:                               "~n   Reason: ~p", [LReason]),
  430:                            (catch gen_udp:close(Sock)),
  431:                            ?SKIPT(?F("Failed get local address: ~w", [LReason]))
  432:                    end
  433:            end,
  434:     TC   = fun(State) -> do_send_to_closed(State) end,
  435:     Post = fun(#{socket := Socket}) ->
  436:                    (catch gen_udp:close(Socket))
  437:            end,
  438:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Pre, TC, Post).
  439: 
  440: do_send_to_closed(#{socket := Sock, local_addr := Addr}) ->
  441:     ?P("~w -> first send to (closed port): "
  442:        "~n   ~p, ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Addr, ?CLOSED_PORT]),
  443:     ok = gen_udp:send(Sock, Addr, ?CLOSED_PORT, "foo"),
  444:     timer:sleep(2),
  445:     ?P("~w -> second send to (closed port): "
  446:        "~n   ~p, ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Addr, ?CLOSED_PORT]),
  447:     ok = gen_udp:send(Sock, Addr, ?CLOSED_PORT, "foo"),
  448:     ?P("~w -> done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  449:     ok.
  450: 
  451: 
  452: 
  453: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  454: %% Send to the empty host name
  455: 
  456: send_to_empty(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  457:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_send_to_empty(Config) end).
  458: 
  459: do_send_to_empty(Config) ->
  460:     {ok, Sock} = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
  461:     element(1, os:type()) =:= unix andalso
  462:         begin
  463:             {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:send(Sock, "", ?CLOSED_PORT, "xXx"),
  464:             {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:send(Sock, '', ?CLOSED_PORT, "xXx")
  465:         end,
  466:     {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:send(Sock, ".", ?CLOSED_PORT, "xXx"),
  467:     {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:send(Sock, '.', ?CLOSED_PORT, "xXx"),
  468:     ok.
  469: 
  470: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  471: %% Test that the UDP socket buffer sizes are settable
  472: 
  473: %% Test UDP buffer size setting.
  474: buffer_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  475:     Cond = fun() ->
  476:                    case os:type() of
  477:                        {win32, nt} ->
  478:                            case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  479:                                true ->
  480:                                    {skip, "TC not compliant with socket (yet)"};
  481:                                false ->
  482:                                    ok
  483:                            end;
  484:                        _ ->
  485:                            ok
  486:                    end
  487:            end,
  488:     TC   = fun() -> do_buffer_size(Config) end,
  489:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, TC).
  490: 
  491: do_buffer_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  492:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
  493:     ClientIP = Addr,
  494:     ServerIP = Addr,
  495:     Len = 256,
  496:     Bin = list_to_binary(lists:seq(0, Len-1)),
  497:     M = 8192 div Len,
  498:     SAFE = 3,
  499:     LONG = 1,
  500:     Spec0 =
  501: 	[
  502:          {opt, M},   {safe, M   - SAFE}, {long, M   + LONG},
  503: 	 {opt, 2*M}, {safe, 2*M - SAFE}, {long, 2*M + LONG},
  504: 	 {opt, 4*M}, {safe, 4*M - SAFE}, {long, 4*M + LONG}
  505:         ],
  506:     Spec =
  507: 	[case Tag of
  508: 	     opt ->
  509: 		 [{recbuf,Val*Len},{sndbuf,(Val + 2)*Len}];
  510: 	     safe ->
  511: 		 {list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(Val, Bin)),
  512: 		  [correct]};
  513: 	     long ->
  514: 		 {list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(Val, Bin)),
  515: 		  [truncated,emsgsize,timeout]}
  516: 	 end || {Tag,Val} <- Spec0],
  517:     %%
  518:     {ok, ClientSocket} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, ClientIP}]),
  519:     {ok, ClientPort}   = inet:port(ClientSocket),
  520:     Client = self(),
  521:     ?P("Client: {~p, ~p}, ~p", [ClientIP, ClientPort, ClientSocket]),
  522:     Server =
  523: 	spawn_link(
  524: 	  fun () ->
  525:                   ?P("buffer_size[server] -> starting"),
  526: 		  {ok, ServerSocket} =
  527:                       ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, ServerIP}]),
  528: 		  {ok, ServerPort}   =
  529:                       inet:port(ServerSocket),
  530: 		  Client ! {self(),port,ServerPort},
  531: 		  buffer_size_server(Client, ClientIP, ClientPort, 
  532: 				     ServerSocket, 1, Spec),
  533: 		  ok = gen_udp:close(ServerSocket)
  534: 	  end),
  535:     Mref = erlang:monitor(process, Server),
  536:     receive
  537: 	{Server, port, ServerPort} ->
  538:             ?P("Server: {~p, ~p}, ~p", [ServerIP, ServerPort, Server]),
  539: 	    buffer_size_client(Server, ServerIP, ServerPort,
  540: 			       ClientSocket, 1, Spec)
  541:     end,
  542:     ok = gen_udp:close(ClientSocket),
  543:     receive
  544: 	{'DOWN',Mref,_,_,normal} ->
  545: 	    ok
  546:     end.
  547: 
  548: buffer_size_client(_, _, _, _, _, []) ->
  549:     ok;
  550: buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, 
  551: 		   Socket, Cnt, [Opts|T]) when is_list(Opts) ->
  552:     ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> entry with"
  553:        "~n   Opts: ~p", [Cnt, Opts]),
  554:     ok = inet:setopts(Socket, Opts),
  555:     GOpts = [K || {K, _} <- Opts],
  556:     ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> options after set: "
  557:        "~n   ~p", [Cnt, inet:getopts(Socket, GOpts)]),
  558:     Server ! {self(),setopts,Cnt},
  559:     receive {Server,setopts,Cnt} -> ok end,
  560:     buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt+1, T);
  561: buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, 
  562: 		   Socket, Cnt, [{B,Replies}|T]=Opts) when is_binary(B) ->
  563:     ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> entry with"
  564:        "~n   send size:   ~w"
  565:        "~n   expecting:   ~p"
  566:        "~nwhen"
  567:        "~n   Socket Info: ~p",
  568:        [Cnt, byte_size(B), Replies, inet:info(Socket)]),
  569:     case gen_udp:send(Socket, IP, Port, <<Cnt,B/binary>>) of
  570: 	ok ->
  571: 	    receive
  572: 		{Server, Cnt, Reply} ->
  573:                     ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> "
  574:                        "~n   Reply: ~p", [Cnt, Reply]),
  575: 		    Tag =
  576:                         case Reply of
  577:                             %% {completion_status, #{info := Tag0}}
  578:                             %%   when is_atom(Tag0) ->
  579:                             %%     Tag0;
  580:                             %% {completion_status, Tag0} when is_atom(Tag0) ->
  581:                             %%     Tag0;
  582:                             {Tag0, _} ->
  583:                                 Tag0;
  584:                             Tag0 when is_atom(Tag0) ->
  585:                                 Tag0
  586:                         end,
  587: 		    case lists:member(Tag, Replies) of
  588: 			true -> ok;
  589: 			false ->
  590:                             ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> "
  591:                                "missing from expected replies: "
  592:                                "~n   Tag:     ~p"
  593:                                "~n   Replies: ~p", [Cnt, Tag, Replies]),
  594: 			    ct:fail({reply_mismatch,Cnt,Reply,Replies,
  595: 				     byte_size(B),
  596: 				     inet:getopts(Socket,
  597: 						  [sndbuf,recbuf])})
  598: 		    end,
  599: 		    buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt+1, T)
  600: 	    after 1313 ->
  601:                     %% ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> timeout", [Cnt]),
  602: 		    buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt, Opts)
  603: 	    end;
  604: 
  605: 	{error, enobufs = Reason} ->
  606: 	    ?P("<WARNING> send failed with '~w' - system overload => SKIP"),
  607: 	    ?SKIPE(Reason);
  608: 
  609: 	{error, Reason} ->
  610: 	    ?P("<ERROR> Client failed sending ~w bytes of data: "
  611: 	       "~n   SndBuf: ~p"
  612: 	       "~n   Reason: ~p",
  613: 	       [byte_size(B), inet:getopts(Socket, [sndbuf]), Reason]),
  614: 	    ct:fail(Reason)
  615:     end.
  616: 
  617: buffer_size_server(_, _, _, _, _, []) -> 
  618:     ok;
  619: buffer_size_server(Client, IP, Port, 
  620: 		   Socket, Cnt, [Opts|T]) when is_list(Opts) ->
  621:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> entry when await client setopts", [Cnt]),
  622:     receive {Client, setopts, Cnt} -> ok end,
  623:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> setopts with "
  624:        "~n   Opts:        ~p"
  625:        "~nwhen"
  626:        "~n   Socket info: ~p", [Cnt, Opts, inet:info(Socket)]),
  627:     ok = inet:setopts(Socket, Opts),
  628:     GOpts = [K || {K, _} <- Opts],
  629:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> options after set: "
  630:        "~n                ~p"
  631:        "~nwhen"
  632:        "~n   Socket info: ~p",
  633:        [Cnt, inet:getopts(Socket, GOpts), inet:info(Socket)]),
  634:     Client ! {self(), setopts, Cnt},
  635:     buffer_size_server(Client, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt+1, T);
  636: buffer_size_server(Client, IP, Port, 
  637: 		   Socket, Cnt, [{B,_}|T]) when is_binary(B) ->
  638:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> entry when"
  639:        "~n   expect ~w bytes of data"
  640:        "~nwhen"
  641:        "~n   Socket info: ~p"
  642:        "~n   MQ:          ~p", [Cnt, byte_size(B), inet:info(Socket), mq()]),
  643:     Reply = case buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt) of
  644:                 D when is_binary(D) ->
  645:                     SizeD = byte_size(D),
  646:                     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received: ~w bytes of data"
  647:                       "~nwhen"
  648:                        "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [Cnt, SizeD, inet:info(Socket)]),
  649:                     case B of
  650:                         D ->
  651:                             correct;
  652:                         <<D:SizeD/binary,_/binary>> ->
  653:                             truncated;
  654:                         _ ->
  655:                             {unexpected,D}
  656:                     end;
  657:                 Error ->
  658:                     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> error:"
  659:                        "~n                ~p"
  660:                        "~nwhen"
  661:                        "~n   Socket Info: ~p",
  662:                        [Cnt, Error, inet:info(Socket)]),
  663:                     Error
  664:             end,
  665:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> send reply '~p' when"
  666:        "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [Cnt, Reply, inet:info(Socket)]),
  667:     Client ! {self(), Cnt, Reply},
  668:     ?SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
  669:     buffer_size_server(Client, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt+1, T).
  670: 
  671: buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt) ->
  672:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> await data: "
  673:        "~n   Socket:      ~p"
  674:        "~n   IP:          ~p"
  675:        "~n   Port:        ~p"
  676:        "~nwhen"
  677:        "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [Cnt, Socket, IP, Port, inet:info(Socket)]),
  678:     receive
  679: 	{udp, Socket, IP, Port, <<Cnt, B/binary>>} ->
  680:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received ~w bytes",
  681:                [Cnt, byte_size(B)]),
  682: 	    B;
  683: 	{udp, Socket, IP, Port, <<_B/binary>>} ->
  684:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received unexpected ~w bytes",
  685:                [Cnt, byte_size(_B)]),
  686: 	    buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt);
  687: 
  688: 	{udp, Socket, IP, Port, _CRAP} ->
  689:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received unexpected crap", [Cnt]),
  690: 	    buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt);
  691: 
  692: 	{udp, XSocket, XIP, XPort, _CRAP} ->
  693:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received unexpected udp message: "
  694:                "~n   XSocket: ~p"
  695:                "~n   Socket:  ~p"
  696:                "~n   XIP:     ~p"
  697:                "~n   IP:      ~p"
  698:                "~n   XPort:   ~p"
  699:                "~n   Port:    ~p",
  700:                [Cnt, XSocket, Socket, XIP, IP, XPort, Port]),
  701: 	    buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt);
  702: 
  703: 	{udp_closed, Socket} ->
  704:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received unexpected 'closed'", [Cnt]),
  705: 	    closed;
  706: 
  707: 	{udp_error, Socket, Error} ->
  708:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> error: "
  709:                "~n   ~p", [Cnt, Error]),
  710:             ok = inet:setopts(Socket, [{active, true}]),
  711: 	    Error
  712: 
  713:     after 5000 ->
  714:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> timeout: "
  715:                "~n   Socket:       ~p"
  716:                "~n   Socket Info:  ~p"
  717:                "~n   Process Info: ~p",
  718:                [Cnt,
  719:                 Socket, inet:info(Socket), erlang:process_info(self())]),
  720: 	    {timeout, mq()}
  721:     end.
  722: 
  723: 
  724: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  725: %% OTP-15206: Keep buffer small for udp
  726: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  727: max_buffer_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  728:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_max_buffer_size(Config) end).
  729: 
  730: do_max_buffer_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  731:     ?P("create socket"),
  732:     {ok, Socket} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary]),
  733:     ?P("get buffers"),
  734:     {ok, [{recbuf, RecBuf0}, {buffer, Buffer0}]} =
  735:         inet:getopts(Socket, [recbuf, buffer]),
  736:     ?P("buffers: "
  737:        "~n   RecBuf: ~p"
  738:        "~n   Buffer: ~p", [RecBuf0, Buffer0]),
  739:     NewRecBuf = 1 bsl 20,
  740:     ?P("set recbuf: ~w", [NewRecBuf]),
  741:     ok = inet:setopts(Socket, [{recbuf, NewRecBuf}]),
  742:     ?P("get buffers"),
  743:     case inet:getopts(Socket, [recbuf, buffer]) of
  744:         {ok, [{recbuf, RecBuf}, {buffer, 65536 = Buffer}]} ->
  745:             ?P("buffers: expected"
  746:                "~n   RecBuf: ~p"
  747:                "~n   Buffer: ~p", [RecBuf, Buffer]),
  748:             gen_udp:close(Socket),
  749:             ok;
  750:         {ok, [{recbuf, RecBuf}, {buffer, Buffer}]} ->
  751:             ?P("buffers: unexpected"
  752:                "~n   RecBuf: ~p"
  753:                "~n   Buffer: ~p", [RecBuf, Buffer]),
  754:             gen_udp:close(Socket),
  755:             ct:fail({unexpected_buffer_size, Buffer});
  756:         {error, Reason} ->
  757:             ?P("failed extracting buffers"
  758:                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
  759:             (catch gen_udp:close(Socket)),
  760:             ct:fail({unexpected_getopts_error, Reason})
  761:     end,
  762:     ?P("done"),
  763:     ok.
  764:             
  765: 
  766: 
  767: 
  768: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  769: %% OTP-3823 gen_udp:recv does not return address in binary mode
  770: %%
  771: 
  772: %% OTP-3823 gen_udp:recv does not return address in binary mode.
  773: binary_passive_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  774:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_binary_passive_recv(Config) end).
  775: 
  776: do_binary_passive_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  777:     D1       = "The quick brown fox jumps over a lazy dog",
  778:     D2       = list_to_binary(D1),
  779:     D3       = ["The quick", <<" brown ">>, "fox jumps ", <<"over ">>,
  780: 		<<>>, $a, [[], " lazy ", <<"dog">>]],
  781:     D2       = iolist_to_binary(D3),
  782:     B        = D2,
  783:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
  784:     ?P("open receive socket"),
  785:     {ok, R}  = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {active, false}, {debug, true}]),
  786:     ok = inet:setopts(R, [{debug, false}]),
  787:     {ok, RP} = inet:port(R),
  788:     ?P("open send socket"),
  789:     {ok, S}  = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
  790:     {ok, SP} = inet:port(S),
  791:     ?P("try send (to port ~w) ~w bytes (as a list)", [RP, length(D1)]),
  792:     ok       = gen_udp:send(S, Addr, RP, D1),
  793:     ?P("try recv (from port ~w) ~w bytes", [SP, byte_size(B)+1]),
  794:     {ok, {Addr, SP, B}} = gen_udp:recv(R, byte_size(B)+1),
  795:     ?P("try send (to port ~w) ~w bytes (as a binary)", [RP, byte_size(D2)]),
  796:     ok       = gen_udp:send(S, Addr, RP, D2),
  797:     ?P("try recv (from port ~w) ~w bytes", [SP, byte_size(B)+1]),
  798:     {ok, {Addr, SP, B}} = gen_udp:recv(R, byte_size(B)+1),
  799:     ?P("try send (to port ~w) ~w bytes (as a iolist)", [RP, iolist_size(D3)]),
  800:     ok       = gen_udp:send(S, Addr, RP, D3),
  801:     ?P("try recv (from port ~w) ~w bytes", [SP, byte_size(B)+1]),
  802:     {ok, {Addr, SP, B}} = gen_udp:recv(R, byte_size(B)+1),
  803:     ?P("cleanup"),
  804:     ok       = gen_udp:close(S),
  805:     ok       = gen_udp:close(R),
  806:     ?P("done"),
  807:     ok.
  808: 
  809: 
  810: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  811: %% OTP-3836 inet_udp crashes when IP-address is larger than 255.
  812: 
  813: %% OTP-3836 inet_udp crashes when IP-address is larger than 255.
  814: bad_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  815:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_bad_address(Config) end).
  816: 
  817: do_bad_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  818:     ?P("create sockets"),
  819:     {ok, R}   = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
  820:     {ok, RP}  = inet:port(R),
  821:     {ok, S}   = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
  822:     {ok, _SP} = inet:port(S),
  823: 
  824:     ?P("try send to invalid address 1 - expect failure"),
  825:     case (catch gen_udp:send(S, {127,0,0,1,0}, RP, "void")) of
  826:         {'EXIT', badarg} ->
  827:             ok;
  828:         Any1 ->
  829:             ?P("<ERROR> unexpected result: "
  830:                "~n   ~p", [Any1]),
  831:             ct:fail({unexpected_result, 1, Any1})                
  832:     end,
  833: 
  834:     ?P("try send to invalid address 2 - expect failure"),
  835:     case (catch gen_udp:send(S, {127,0,0,256}, RP, "void")) of
  836:         {'EXIT', badarg} ->
  837:             ok;
  838:         Any2 ->
  839:             ?P("<ERROR> unexpected result: "
  840:                "~n   ~p", [Any2]),
  841:             ct:fail({unexpected_result, 2, Any2})
  842:     end,
  843: 
  844:     ?P("cleanup"),
  845:     ok       = gen_udp:close(S),
  846:     ok       = gen_udp:close(R),
  847: 
  848:     ?P("done"),
  849:     ok.
  850: 
  851: 
  852: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  853: %% OTP-6249 UDP option for number of packet reads
  854: %%
  855: %% Starts a node that on command sends a bunch of messages
  856: %% to our UDP port. The receiving process just receives and
  857: %% ignores the incoming messages.
  858: %% A tracing process traces the receiving port for
  859: %% 'send' and scheduling events. From the trace,
  860: %% how many messages are received per in/out scheduling,
  861: %% which should never be more than the read_packet parameter.
  862: 
  863: %% OTP-6249 UDP option for number of packet reads.
  864: read_packets(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  865:     Cond = fun() ->
  866: 		   case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  867: 		       true ->
  868:                            %% We have not (yet) implemented support for 
  869:                            %% this option. We accept it but do not use it.
  870:                            ?P("~w:cond -> skip", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  871: 			   {skip, "Not compliant with socket"};
  872: 		       false ->
  873:                            ?P("~w:cond -> run", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  874: 			   ok
  875: 		   end
  876: 	   end,
  877:     Pre  = fun() ->
  878:                    %% Try start/create a worker node
  879:                    NName = ?UNIQ_NODE_NAME,
  880:                    ?P("~w:pre -> try create node ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, NName]),
  881:                    case start_node(NName) of
  882:                        {ok, Node} ->
  883:                            ?P("~w:pre -> node ~p started",
  884:                               [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node]),
  885:                            #{node => Node,
  886:                              conf => Config};
  887:                        {error, Reason} ->
  888:                            ?P("~w:pre -> Failed start node ~p"
  889:                               "~n   ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, NName, Reason]),
  890:                            {skip, Reason}
  891:                    end
  892:            end,
  893:     TC   = fun(State) ->
  894:                    ?P("~w:tc -> begin", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  895:                    Res = do_read_packets(State),
  896:                    ?P("~w:tc -> done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  897:                    Res
  898:            end,
  899:     Post = fun(#{node := Node}) ->
  900:                    ?P("~w:post -> stop node", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  901:                    stop_node(Node)
  902:            end,
  903:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  904: 
  905: do_read_packets(#{node := Node,
  906:                   conf := Config}) when is_list(Config) ->
  907:     N1   = 5,
  908:     N2   = 1,
  909:     Msgs = 30000,
  910:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
  911:     ?P("open socket (with read-packets: ~p)", [N1]),
  912:     {ok, R}   = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {read_packets,N1}]),
  913:     {ok, {RA, RP}}  = inet:sockname(R),
  914:     ?P("reader: "
  915:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
  916:        "~n   Port: ~p", [RA, RP]),
  917: 
  918:     %%
  919:     ?P("perform read-packets test"),
  920:     {V1, Trace1} = read_packets_test(Config, R, RA, RP, Msgs, Node),
  921:     ?P("verify read-packets (to ~w)", [N1]),
  922:     {ok,[{read_packets,N1}]} = inet:getopts(R, [read_packets]),
  923:     %%
  924:     ?P("set new read-packets: ~p", [N2]),
  925:     ok = inet:setopts(R, [{read_packets, N2}]),
  926:     ?P("perform read-packets test"),
  927:     {V2, Trace2} = read_packets_test(Config, R, RA, RP, Msgs, Node),
  928:     ?P("verify read-packets (to ~w)", [N2]),
  929:     {ok, [{read_packets,N2}]} = inet:getopts(R, [read_packets]),
  930:     %%
  931:     ?P("dump trace 1"),
  932:     dump_terms(Config, "trace1.terms", Trace1),
  933:     ?P("dump trace 2"),
  934:     dump_terms(Config, "trace2.terms", Trace2),
  935: 
  936:     %% Because of the inherit racy-ness of the feature it is
  937:     %% hard to test that it behaves correctly.
  938:     %% Right now (OTP 21) a port task takes 5% of the
  939:     %% allotted port task reductions to execute, so
  940:     %% the max number of executions a port is allowed to
  941:     %% do before being re-scheduled is N * 20
  942: 
  943:     ?P("read-packets test verification when: "
  944:        "~n      N1: ~p"
  945:        "~n      V1: ~p"
  946:        "~n   vs"
  947:        "~n      N2: ~p"
  948:        "~n      V2: ~p", [N1, V1, N2, V2]),
  949:     if
  950:         V1 > (N1 * 20) ->
  951:             ct:fail("Got ~p msgs, max was ~p", [V1, N1]);
  952:         V2 > (N2 * 20) ->
  953:             ct:fail("Got ~p msgs, max was ~p", [V2, N2]);
  954:         true ->
  955:             ok
  956:     end,
  957:     ?P("done"),
  958:     ok.
  959: 
  960: dump_terms(Config, Name, Terms) ->
  961:     FName = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),Name),
  962:     file:write_file(FName, term_to_binary(Terms)),
  963:     ct:log("Logged terms to ~s",[FName]).
  964: 
  965: read_packets_test(Config, R, RA, RP, Msgs, Node) ->
  966:     Receiver = self(),
  967:     Tracer =
  968: 	spawn_link(
  969: 	  fun () ->
  970: 		  receive
  971: 		      {Receiver,get_trace} ->
  972: 			  Receiver ! {self(),{trace,flush()}}
  973: 		  end
  974: 	  end),
  975:     Sender =
  976: 	spawn_opt(
  977: 	  Node,
  978: 	  fun () ->
  979:                   %% We run on the same "machine" as R,
  980:                   %% so use the same addr
  981: 		  {ok, S}  = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, RA}]),
  982: 		  {ok, {SA, SP}} = inet:sockname(S),
  983: 		  Receiver ! {self(),{sockname, {SA, SP}}},
  984: 		  receive
  985: 		      {Receiver,go} ->
  986: 			  read_packets_send(S, RA, RP, Msgs)
  987: 		  end
  988: 	  end, 
  989: 	  [link,{priority,high}]),
  990:     receive
  991: 	{Sender, {sockname, {SA, SP}}} ->
  992: 	    erlang:trace(R, true,
  993: 			 [running_ports,'send',{tracer,Tracer}]),
  994: 	    erlang:yield(),
  995: 	    Sender ! {Receiver,go},
  996: 	    read_packets_recv(Msgs),
  997: 	    erlang:trace(R, false, [all]),
  998: 	    Tracer ! {Receiver,get_trace},
  999: 	    receive
 1000: 		{Tracer,{trace,Trace}} ->
 1001: 		    {read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace), Trace}
 1002: 	    end
 1003:     end.
 1004: 
 1005: read_packets_send(_S, _RA, _RP, 0) ->
 1006:     ok;
 1007: read_packets_send(S, RA, RP, Msgs) ->
 1008:     ok = gen_udp:send(S, RA, RP, "UDP FLOOOOOOD"),
 1009:     read_packets_send(S, RA, RP, Msgs - 1).
 1010: 
 1011: read_packets_recv(0) ->
 1012:     ok;
 1013: read_packets_recv(N) ->
 1014:     receive
 1015: 	_ ->
 1016: 	    read_packets_recv(N - 1)
 1017:     after 5000 ->
 1018: 	    timeout
 1019:     end.
 1020: 
 1021: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace) ->
 1022:     [Max | _] = Pkts =
 1023:         lists:reverse(lists:sort(read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace, 0))),
 1024:     ?P("read-packets verify: ~p", [lists:sublist(Pkts,10)]),
 1025:     Max.
 1026: 
 1027: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, [{trace,R,OutIn,_}|Trace], M) 
 1028:   when OutIn =:= out; OutIn =:= in ->
 1029:     push(M, read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace, 0));
 1030: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, [{trace, R,'receive',timeout}|Trace], M) ->
 1031:     push(M, read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace, 0));
 1032: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP,
 1033: 		    [{trace,R,'send',{udp, R, SA, SP,_Msg}, Self} | Trace], M)
 1034:   when Self =:= self() ->
 1035:     read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace, M+1);
 1036: read_packets_verify(_R, _SA, _SP, [], M) ->
 1037:     push(M, []);
 1038: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, [T | Trace], M) ->
 1039:     ct:fail(
 1040:       {read_packets_verify, mismatch, self(),
 1041:        {R, SA, SP, [T, length(Trace)], M}});
 1042: read_packets_verify(_R, _SA, _SP, Trace, M) ->
 1043:     ct:fail({read_packets_verify,mismatch,Trace,M}).
 1044: 
 1045: push(0, Vs) ->
 1046:     Vs;
 1047: push(V, Vs) ->
 1048:     [V|Vs].
 1049: 
 1050: flush() ->
 1051:     receive
 1052: 	X ->
 1053: 	    [X|flush()]
 1054:     after 200 ->
 1055: 	    []
 1056:     end.
 1057: 
 1058: 
 1059: %% OTP-16059
 1060: %% UDP recv with timeout 0 corrupts internal state so that after a
 1061: %% recv under {active, once} the UDP recv poll wastes incoming data
 1062: recv_poll_after_active_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1063:     Msg1 = <<"Hej!">>,
 1064:     Msg2 = <<"Hej igen!">>,
 1065:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
 1066:     %% Addr = {127,0,0,1},
 1067:     {ok,S1} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}, {active, once}]),
 1068:     {ok,P1} = inet:port(S1),
 1069:     {ok,S2} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}, {active, false}]),
 1070:     {ok,P2} = inet:port(S2),
 1071:     ok = gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P1, Msg1),
 1072:     receive
 1073:         {udp, S1, Addr, P2, Msg1} ->
 1074:             {error, timeout} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, 0),
 1075:             ok = gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P1, Msg2),
 1076:             receive after 500 -> ok end, % Give the kernel time to deliver
 1077:             {ok, {Addr, P2, Msg2}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, 0),
 1078:             ok
 1079:     end.
 1080: 
 1081: 
 1082: %% Test that the 'fd' option works.
 1083: open_fd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1084:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1085:             fun() -> is_not_windows() end,
 1086:             fun() -> do_open_fd(Config) end).
 1087: 
 1088: do_open_fd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1089:     Msg = "Det gr ont nr knoppar brista. Varfr skulle annars vren tveka?",
 1090:     Addr = {127,0,0,1},
 1091:     ?P("try open first (default domain = inet) socket and get its fd"),
 1092:     {S1, FD} = case ?OPEN(Config, 0) of
 1093:                    {ok, Sock1} when is_port(Sock1) ->
 1094:                        {ok, FileDesc1} = prim_inet:getfd(Sock1),
 1095:                        {Sock1, FileDesc1};
 1096:                    {ok, Sock1} ->
 1097:                       {ok, [{fd, FileDesc1}]} =
 1098:                           gen_udp_socket:getopts(Sock1, [fd]),
 1099:                       {Sock1, FileDesc1}
 1100:                end,
 1101:     ?P("try get the socket port number"),
 1102:     {ok, P2} = inet:port(S1),
 1103: 
 1104:     ?P("try open second (domain = inet6) socket with FD = ~w "
 1105:        "and expect *failure*", [FD]),
 1106: 
 1107:     OS = which_os(),
 1108: 
 1109:     case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{debug, true}, inet6, {fd,FD}]) of
 1110:         {error, einval = Reason} ->
 1111:             ?P("expected failure reason ~w", [Reason]),
 1112:             ok;
 1113:         {error, eafnosupport = Reason} ->
 1114:             ?P("expected failure reason ~w (IPv6 not supported?)", [Reason]),
 1115:             ok;
 1116:         {error, Reason} ->
 1117:             ?P("unexpected failure: ~w", [Reason]),
 1118:             ct:fail({unexpected_failure, Reason});
 1119:         {ok, Socket} when (OS =:= darwin) ->
 1120:             ?P("unexpected success: "
 1121:                "~n   ~p", [inet:info(Socket)]),
 1122:             (catch gen_udp:close(Socket)),
 1123:             (catch gen_udp:close(S1)),
 1124:             skip(unexpected_succes);
 1125:         {ok, Socket} ->
 1126:             ?P("unexpected success: "
 1127:                "~n   ~p", [inet:info(Socket)]),
 1128:             (catch gen_udp:close(Socket)),
 1129:             (catch gen_udp:close(S1)),
 1130:             case ((OS =:= darwin) andalso ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config)) of
 1131:                 true ->
 1132:                     %% This should not work, but on (some) Darwin
 1133:                     %% machines it does...
 1134:                     skip(unexpected_success);
 1135:                 _ ->
 1136:                     ct:fail(unexpected_success)
 1137:             end
 1138:     end,
 1139: 
 1140:     ?P("try open second socket with FD = ~w "
 1141:        "and expect success", [FD]),
 1142:     {ok, S2} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{fd, FD}]),
 1143:     {ok, P2} = inet:port(S2),
 1144: 
 1145:     ?P("try open third socket and expect success"),
 1146:     {ok, S3} = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
 1147:     {ok, P3} = inet:port(S3),
 1148: 
 1149:     ?P("try send message from socket 3 to socket 2 (~w)", [P2]),
 1150:     ok = gen_udp:send(S3, Addr, P2, Msg),
 1151:     receive
 1152: 	{udp, S2, Addr, P3, Msg} ->
 1153:             ?P("expected recv - "
 1154:                "try send message from socket 2 to socket 3 (~w)", [P3]),
 1155: 	    ok = gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P3, Msg),
 1156: 	    receive
 1157: 		{udp, S3, Addr, P2, Msg} ->
 1158:                     ?P("expected recv - done"),
 1159: 		    ok
 1160: 	    after 1000 ->
 1161:                     ?P("unexpected timeout"),
 1162: 		    ct:fail(io_lib:format("~w", [flush()]))
 1163: 	    end
 1164:     after 1000 ->
 1165:             ?P("unexpected timeout"),
 1166: 	    ct:fail(io_lib:format("~w", [flush()]))
 1167:     end,
 1168:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1169:     (catch gen_udp:close(S3)),
 1170:     (catch gen_udp:close(S2)),
 1171:     (catch gen_udp:close(S1)),
 1172:     ?P("done"),
 1173:     ok.
 1174: 
 1175: active_n(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1176:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_active_n(Config) end).
 1177: 
 1178: do_active_n(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1179:     N = 3,
 1180:     ?P("create socket (1) with active = ~w", [N]),
 1181:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
 1182:     S1 = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,N}])),
 1183:     ?P("verify socket active = ~w (~p)", [N, which_info(S1)]),
 1184:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1185: 
 1186:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect passive", [-N]),
 1187:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,-N}]),
 1188:     receive
 1189:         {udp_passive, S1} ->
 1190:             ?P("expected passive received"),
 1191:             ok
 1192:     after
 1193:         5000 ->
 1194:             ?P("ERROR: passive *not* received"),
 1195:             exit({error,udp_passive_failure})
 1196:     end,
 1197:     ?P("verify socket active passive (=false) (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1198:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1199: 
 1200:     ?P("set active = 0 and expect passive message"),
 1201:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active, 0}]),
 1202:     receive
 1203:         {udp_passive, S1} ->
 1204:             ?P("expected passive received"),
 1205:             ok
 1206:     after
 1207:         5000 ->
 1208:             ?P("ERROR: passive *not* received"),
 1209:             exit({error,udp_passive_failure})
 1210:     end,
 1211: 
 1212:     ?P("set active = 32767 (=max) and expect success"),
 1213:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,32767}]),
 1214:     ?P("try set active = 1 (already at max) and expect failure (einval)"),
 1215:     {error, einval} = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,1}]),
 1216:     ?P("set active = -32769 (<min) and expect failure (einval)"),
 1217:     {error, einval} = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,-32769}]),
 1218:     ?P("set active = -32768 and expect passive message"),
 1219:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,-32768}]),
 1220:     receive
 1221:         {udp_passive, S1} ->
 1222:             ?P("expected passive received"),
 1223:             ok
 1224:     after
 1225:         5000 ->
 1226:             ?P("ERROR: passive *not* received"),
 1227:             exit({error,udp_passive_failure})
 1228:     end,
 1229: 
 1230:     ?P("verify socket active passive (=false), (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1231:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1232:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [N]),
 1233:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,N}]),
 1234:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [true]),
 1235:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,true}]),
 1236:     ?P("verify socket active active (=true) (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1237:     [{active,true}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1238:     ?P("verify nothing in the message queue"),
 1239:     receive
 1240:         Unexpected_1 ->
 1241:             ?P("ERROR: something in the message queue: "
 1242:                "~n   ~p", [Unexpected_1]),
 1243:             exit({error, active_n, Unexpected_1})
 1244:     after
 1245:         0 ->
 1246:             ?P("nothing in the message queue"),
 1247:             ok
 1248:     end,
 1249: 
 1250:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [N]),
 1251:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,N}]),
 1252:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [once]),
 1253:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,once}]),
 1254:     ?P("verify socket active active (=once) (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1255:     [{active,once}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1256:     receive
 1257:         Unexpected_2 ->
 1258:             ?P("ERROR: something in the message queue: "
 1259:                "~n   ~p", [Unexpected_2]),
 1260:             exit({error,active_n, Unexpected_2})
 1261:     after
 1262:         0 ->
 1263:             ?P("nothing in the message queue"),
 1264:             ok
 1265:     end,
 1266: 
 1267:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect failure (einval)", [32768]),
 1268:     {error,einval} = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,32768}]),
 1269:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [false]),
 1270:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,false}]),
 1271:     ?P("verify socket active passive (=false) (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1272:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1273: 
 1274:      %% S1Port = ok(inet:port(S1)),
 1275:     {S1Addr, S1Port} = ok(inet:sockname(S1)),
 1276:     ?P("S1 sockname: "
 1277:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
 1278:        "~n   Port: ~p", [S1Addr, S1Port]),
 1279: 
 1280:     ?P("create socket (2) with active = ~w", [N]),
 1281:     S2 = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,N}])),
 1282: 
 1283:     %% S2Port = ok(inet:port(S2)),
 1284:     {S2Addr, S2Port} = ok(inet:sockname(S2)),
 1285:     ?P("S2 sockname: "
 1286:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
 1287:        "~n   Port: ~p", [S2Addr, S2Port]),
 1288: 
 1289:     ?P("verify socket (2) active = ~w (~p)", [N, which_info(S2)]),
 1290:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(S2, [active])),
 1291:     ?P("set socket (1) active = ~w and expect success", [N]),
 1292:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,N}]),
 1293:     ?P("verify socket (1) active = ~w (~p)", [N, which_info(S1)]),
 1294:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1295:     ?P("generate ~w message(s) and send them: S1 -> S2 and S2 -> S1 when:"
 1296:        "~n   Socket 1 info: ~p"
 1297:        "~n   Socket 2 info: ~p", [N, inet:info(S1), inet:info(S2)]),
 1298:     lists:foreach(
 1299:       fun(I) ->
 1300:               Msg = "message "++integer_to_list(I),
 1301:               ?P("send message ~w from S2 to S1 (~p, ~w):"
 1302:                  "~n   S1 info: ~p"
 1303:                  "~n   S2 info: ~p",
 1304:                  [I, S1Addr, S1Port, inet:info(S1), inet:info(S2)]),
 1305:               case gen_udp:send(S2, S1Addr, S1Port, Msg) of
 1306:                   ok ->
 1307:                       ok;
 1308:                   {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 1309:                       ?P("Failed sending message ~w: "
 1310:                          "~n   ~p", [N, Reason]),
 1311:                       exit(ERROR)
 1312:               end,
 1313:               ?P("expect message on S1"),
 1314:               receive
 1315:                   {udp, S1, _, S2Port, Msg} ->
 1316:                       ?P("expected message received on S1 - "
 1317:                          "send message back: from S1 to S2 (~p, ~w): "
 1318:                          "~n   ~p", [S2Addr, S2Port, inet:info(S1)]),
 1319:                       ok = gen_udp:send(S1, S2Addr, S2Port, Msg)
 1320:               after
 1321:                   5000 ->
 1322:                       ?P("ERROR: received nothing (->S1)"),
 1323:                       exit({error,timeout})
 1324:               end,
 1325:               ?P("expect message on S2"),
 1326:               receive
 1327:                   {udp, S2, _, S1Port, Msg} ->
 1328:                       ?P("expected message received on S2: "
 1329:                          "~n   ~p", [inet:info(S2)]),
 1330:                       ok
 1331:               after
 1332:                   5000 ->
 1333:                       ?P("ERROR: received nothing (->S2)"),
 1334:                       exit({error,timeout})
 1335:               end
 1336:       end, lists:seq(1,N)),
 1337:     ?P("expect passive message for socket (1)"),
 1338:     receive
 1339:         {udp_passive, S1} ->
 1340:             ?P("received passive message for socket (1) - "
 1341:                "verify socket active passive (false)"),
 1342:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active]))
 1343:     after
 1344:         5000 ->
 1345:             ?P("ERROR: received nothing (1)"),
 1346:             exit({error,udp_passive})
 1347:     end,
 1348:     ?P("expect passive message for socket (2)"),
 1349:     receive
 1350:         {udp_passive,S2} ->
 1351:             ?P("received passive message for socket (2) - "
 1352:                "verify socket active passive (false)"),
 1353:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S2, [active]))
 1354:     after
 1355:         5000 ->
 1356:             ?P("ERROR: received nothing (2)"),
 1357:             exit({error,udp_passive})
 1358:     end,
 1359: 
 1360:     ?P("create socket (3) with active = ~w and expect passive message", [0]),
 1361:     S3 = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,0}])),
 1362:     receive
 1363:         {udp_passive,S3} ->
 1364:             ?P("received passive message for socket (3) - "
 1365:                "verify socket active passive (false)"),
 1366:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S3, [active]))
 1367:     after
 1368:         5000 ->
 1369:             ?P("ERROR: received nothing (3)"),
 1370:             exit({error,udp_passive})
 1371:     end,
 1372: 
 1373:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1374:     ok = gen_udp:close(S3),
 1375:     ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 1376:     ok = gen_udp:close(S1),
 1377: 
 1378:     ?P("done"),
 1379:     ok.
 1380: 
 1381: 
 1382: 
 1383: recvtos(Config) ->
 1384:     test_recv_opts(
 1385:       Config,
 1386:       inet, [{recvtos,tos,96}], false,
 1387:       fun recvtos_ok/2).
 1388: 
 1389: recvtosttl(Config) ->
 1390:     test_recv_opts(
 1391:       Config,
 1392:       inet, [{recvtos,tos,96},{recvttl,ttl,33}], false,
 1393:       fun (OSType, OSVer) ->
 1394:               recvtos_ok(OSType, OSVer) andalso recvttl_ok(OSType, OSVer)
 1395:       end).
 1396: 
 1397: recvttl(Config) ->
 1398:     test_recv_opts(
 1399:       Config,
 1400:       inet, [{recvttl,ttl,33}], false,
 1401:       fun recvttl_ok/2).
 1402: 
 1403: recvtclass(Config) ->
 1404:     {ok,IFs} = inet:getifaddrs(),
 1405:     case
 1406:         [Name ||
 1407:             {Name,Opts} <- IFs,
 1408:             lists:member({addr,{0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1}}, Opts)]
 1409:     of
 1410:         [_] ->
 1411:             test_recv_opts(
 1412:               Config,
 1413:               inet6, [{recvtclass,tclass,224}], false,
 1414:               fun recvtclass_ok/2);
 1415:         [] ->
 1416:             {skip,ipv6_not_supported,IFs}
 1417:     end.
 1418: 
 1419: 
 1420: sendtos(Config) ->
 1421:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_sendtos(Config) end).
 1422: 
 1423: do_sendtos(Config) ->
 1424:     test_recv_opts(
 1425:       Config,
 1426:       inet, [{recvtos,tos,96}], true,
 1427:       fun sendtos_ok/2).
 1428: 
 1429: sendtosttl(Config) ->
 1430:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_sendtosttl(Config) end).
 1431: 
 1432: do_sendtosttl(Config) ->
 1433:     test_recv_opts(
 1434:       Config,
 1435:       inet, [{recvtos,tos,96},{recvttl,ttl,33}], true,
 1436:       fun (OSType, OSVer) ->
 1437:               sendtos_ok(OSType, OSVer) andalso sendttl_ok(OSType, OSVer)
 1438:       end).
 1439: 
 1440: sendttl(Config) ->
 1441:     ?TC_TRY(sendttl, fun() -> do_sendttl(Config) end).
 1442: 
 1443: do_sendttl(Config) ->
 1444:     test_recv_opts(
 1445:       Config,
 1446:       inet, [{recvttl,ttl,33}], true,
 1447:       fun sendttl_ok/2).
 1448: 
 1449: sendtclass(Config) ->
 1450:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_sendtclass(Config) end).
 1451: 
 1452: do_sendtclass(Config) ->
 1453:     {ok,IFs} = inet:getifaddrs(),
 1454:     case
 1455:         [Name ||
 1456:             {Name,Opts} <- IFs,
 1457:             lists:member({addr,{0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1}}, Opts)]
 1458:     of
 1459:         [_] ->
 1460:             test_recv_opts(
 1461:               Config,
 1462:               inet6, [{recvtclass,tclass,224}], true,
 1463:               fun sendtclass_ok/2);
 1464:         [] ->
 1465:             {skip, {ipv6_not_supported, IFs}}
 1466:     end.
 1467: 
 1468: 
 1469: %% These version numbers are just above the highest noted in daily tests
 1470: %% where the test fails for a plausible reason, that is the lowest
 1471: %% where we can expect that the test might succeed, so
 1472: %% skip on platforms lower than this.
 1473: %%
 1474: %% On newer versions it might be fixed, but we'll see about that
 1475: %% when machines with newer versions gets installed...
 1476: %% If the test still fails for a plausible reason these
 1477: %% version numbers simply should be increased.
 1478: %% Or maybe we should change to only test on known good platforms?
 1479: 
 1480: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1481: recvtos_ok({unix,darwin}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {17,6,0});
 1482: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1483: recvtos_ok({unix,openbsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {6,9,0});
 1484: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1485: recvtos_ok({unix,netbsd}, _OSVer) -> false;
 1486: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1487: recvtos_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1488: %%
 1489: recvtos_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1490: recvtos_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1491: 
 1492: %% Option has no effect
 1493: recvttl_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1494: %%
 1495: recvttl_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1496: recvttl_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1497: 
 1498: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1499: recvtclass_ok({unix,darwin}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {9,9,0});
 1500: recvtclass_ok({unix,linux}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {2,6,11});
 1501: %% Option has no effect
 1502: recvtclass_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1503: %%
 1504: recvtclass_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1505: recvtclass_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1506: 
 1507: 
 1508: %% To send ancillary data seems to require much higher version numbers
 1509: %% than receiving it...
 1510: %%
 1511: 
 1512: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1513: sendtos_ok({unix,darwin}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {19,0,0});
 1514: sendtos_ok({unix,netbsd}, _OSVer) -> false;
 1515: sendtos_ok({unix,openbsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {6,9,0});
 1516: sendtos_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1517: sendtos_ok({unix,linux}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {4,0,0});
 1518: sendtos_ok({unix,freebsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {13,1,0});
 1519: %%
 1520: sendtos_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1521: sendtos_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1522: 
 1523: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1524: sendttl_ok({unix,darwin}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {19,6,0});
 1525: sendttl_ok({unix,linux}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {4,0,0});
 1526: %% Using the option returns enoprotoopt, so it is not implemented.
 1527: sendttl_ok({unix,freebsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {13,1,0});
 1528: %% Option has no effect
 1529: sendttl_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1530: sendttl_ok({unix,openbsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {6,9,0});
 1531: %%
 1532: sendttl_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1533: sendttl_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1534: 
 1535: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1536: sendtclass_ok({unix,darwin}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {9,9,0});
 1537: sendtclass_ok({unix,linux}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {2,6,11});
 1538: %% Option has no effect
 1539: sendtclass_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1540: %%
 1541: sendtclass_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1542: sendtclass_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1543: 
 1544: 
 1545: semver_lt({X1,Y1,Z1} = V1, {X2,Y2,Z2} = V2) ->
 1546:     ?P("semver_lt -> OS version check:"
 1547:        "~n   Version 1: ~p"
 1548:        "~n   Version 2: ~p", [V1, V2]),
 1549:     if
 1550:         X1 > X2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> X1 > X2: ~p > ~p", [X1, X2]), false;
 1551:         X1 < X2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> X1 < X2: ~p < ~p", [X1, X2]), true;
 1552:         Y1 > Y2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> Y1 > Y2: ~p > ~p", [Y1, Y2]), false;
 1553:         Y1 < Y2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> Y1 < Y2: ~p < ~p", [Y1, Y2]), true;
 1554:         Z1 > Z2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> Z1 > Z2: ~p > ~p", [Z1, Z2]), false;
 1555:         Z1 < Z2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> Z1 < Z2: ~p < ~p", [Z1, Z2]), true;
 1556:         true    -> ?P("semver_lt -> default"), false
 1557:     end;
 1558: semver_lt(V1, {_,_,_} = V2) ->
 1559:     ?P("semver_lt -> fallback OS version check when: "
 1560:        "~n   Version 1: ~p"
 1561:        "~n   Version 2: ~p", [V1, V2]),
 1562:     false.
 1563: 
 1564: test_recv_opts(Config, Family, Spec, TestSend, OSFilter) ->
 1565:     OSType = os:type(),
 1566:     OSVer  = os:version(),
 1567:     case OSFilter(OSType, OSVer) of
 1568:         true ->
 1569:             ?P("OS: ~p, ~p", [OSType, OSVer]),
 1570:             test_recv_opts(Config,
 1571:                            Family, Spec, TestSend, OSType, OSVer);
 1572:         false ->
 1573:             {skip,{not_supported_for_os_version,{OSType,OSVer}}}
 1574:     end.
 1575: %%
 1576: test_recv_opts(Config, Family, Spec, TestSend, _OSType, _OSVer) ->
 1577:     Timeout = 5000,
 1578:     RecvOpts = [RecvOpt || {RecvOpt,_,_} <- Spec],
 1579:     TrueRecvOpts = [{RecvOpt,true} || {RecvOpt,_,_} <- Spec],
 1580:     FalseRecvOpts = [{RecvOpt,false} || {RecvOpt,_,_} <- Spec],
 1581:     Opts = [Opt || {_,Opt,_} <- Spec],
 1582:     OptsVals = [{Opt,Val} || {_,Opt,Val} <- Spec],
 1583:     TrueRecvOpts_OptsVals = TrueRecvOpts ++ OptsVals,
 1584:     Addr =
 1585:         case Family of
 1586:             inet ->
 1587:                 {127,0,0,1};
 1588:             inet6 ->
 1589:                 {0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1}
 1590:         end,
 1591:     %%
 1592:     ?P("try open socket (1) with true opts"),
 1593:     {ok, S1} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [Family, binary, {active,false}|TrueRecvOpts]),
 1594:     {ok, P1} = inet:port(S1),
 1595:     ?P("try get (true) socket (1) opts"),
 1596:     {ok, TrueRecvOpts} = inet:getopts(S1, RecvOpts),
 1597:     ?P("try set (false) socket (1) opts"),
 1598:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, FalseRecvOpts),
 1599:     ?P("verify (false) socket (1) opts"),
 1600:     {ok, FalseRecvOpts} = inet:getopts(S1, RecvOpts),
 1601:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, TrueRecvOpts_OptsVals),
 1602:     {ok,TrueRecvOpts_OptsVals} = inet:getopts(S1, RecvOpts ++ Opts),
 1603:     %%
 1604:     %% S1 now has true receive options and set option values
 1605:     %%
 1606:     ?P("try open socket (2) with false opts"),
 1607:     {ok, S2} =
 1608:         ?OPEN(Config, 0, [Family, binary, {active,true} | FalseRecvOpts]),
 1609:     {ok, P2} = inet:port(S2),
 1610:     ?P("try get (false) socket (2) opts"),
 1611:     {ok, FalseRecvOpts_OptsVals2} = inet:getopts(S2, RecvOpts ++ Opts),
 1612:     OptsVals2 = FalseRecvOpts_OptsVals2 -- FalseRecvOpts,
 1613:     ?P("info: "
 1614:        "~n   Socket 1:    ~p"
 1615:        "~n   Socket 2:    ~p"
 1616:        "~n   Opts Vals 2: ~p", [inet:info(S1), inet:info(S2), OptsVals2]),
 1617: 
 1618:     %%
 1619:     %% S2 now has false receive options and default option values,
 1620:     %% OptsVals2 contains the default option values
 1621:     %%
 1622:     ?P("send/3: S2 -> S1"),
 1623:     ok = gen_udp:send(S2, {Addr,P1}, <<"abcde">>),
 1624:     ?SLEEP(100),
 1625: 
 1626:     ?P("send/4: S1 -> S2"),
 1627:     ok = gen_udp:send(S1, Addr, P2, <<"fghij">>),
 1628:     TestSend andalso
 1629:         begin
 1630:             ?P("send/5: S2 -> S1"
 1631:                "~n   ~p", [OptsVals]),
 1632:             case gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P1, OptsVals, <<"ABCDE">>) of
 1633:                 ok ->
 1634:                     ?SLEEP(100),
 1635:                     ok;
 1636:                 {error, enoprotoopt = Reason1} ->
 1637:                     ?SKIPT(?F("send (1) failed: ~p", [Reason1]))
 1638:             end,
 1639:             ?P("send/4: S2 -> S1"
 1640:                "~n   ~p", [OptsVals]),
 1641:             case gen_udp:send(S2, {Addr,P1}, OptsVals, <<"12345">>) of
 1642:                 ok ->
 1643:                     ?SLEEP(100),
 1644:                     ok;
 1645:                 {error, enoprotoopt = Reason2} ->
 1646:                     ?SKIPT(?F("send (2) failed: ~p", [Reason2]))
 1647:             end
 1648:         end,
 1649:     ?P("try S1 recv"),
 1650:     {ok,{_,P2,OptsVals3, <<"abcde">>}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, Timeout),
 1651:     ?P("S1 recv: "
 1652:        "~n   OptsVals3: ~p", [OptsVals3]),
 1653:     ?SLEEP(100),
 1654: 
 1655:     verify_sets_eq(OptsVals3, OptsVals2),
 1656:     TestSend andalso
 1657:         begin
 1658:             ?P("try S1 recv"),
 1659:             {ok,{_,P2,OptsVals0,<<"ABCDE">>}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, Timeout),
 1660:             ?P("S1 recv: "
 1661:                "~n   OptsVals0: ~p", [OptsVals0]),
 1662:             ?SLEEP(100),
 1663: 
 1664:             ?P("try S1 recv"),
 1665:             {ok,{_,P2,OptsVals1,<<"12345">>}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, Timeout),
 1666:             ?P("S1 recv: "
 1667:                "~n   OptsVals1: ~p", [OptsVals1]),
 1668:             ?SLEEP(100),
 1669:             verify_sets_eq(OptsVals0, OptsVals),
 1670:             verify_sets_eq(OptsVals1, OptsVals)
 1671:         end,
 1672:     ?P("await message on S2"),
 1673:     receive
 1674:         {udp, S2, _, P1, <<"fghij">>} ->
 1675:             ?P("S2 received message"),
 1676:             ok;
 1677:         Other1 ->
 1678:             exit({unexpected,Other1})
 1679:     after Timeout ->
 1680:             exit(timeout)
 1681:     end,
 1682:     %%
 1683:     ?P("try set (false) socket (1) opts"),
 1684:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, FalseRecvOpts),
 1685:     ?P("verify (false) socket (1) opts"),
 1686:     {ok, FalseRecvOpts} = inet:getopts(S1, RecvOpts),
 1687:     ?P("try set (true) socket (1) opts"),
 1688:     ok = inet:setopts(S2, TrueRecvOpts),
 1689:     ?P("verify (true) socket (1) opts"),
 1690:     {ok,TrueRecvOpts} = inet:getopts(S2, RecvOpts),
 1691:     %%
 1692:     %% S1 now has false receive options and set option values
 1693:     %%
 1694:     %% S2 now has true receive options and default option values
 1695:     %%
 1696:     ?P("send/4: S2 -> S1"),
 1697:     ok = gen_udp:send(S2, {Addr,P1}, [], <<"klmno">>),
 1698:     ?SLEEP(100),
 1699: 
 1700:     ?P("send/3: S1 -> S2"),
 1701:     ok = gen_udp:send(S1, {Family,{loopback,P2}}, <<"pqrst">>),
 1702:     ?SLEEP(100),
 1703: 
 1704:     TestSend andalso
 1705:         begin
 1706:             ?P("send/4: S1 -> S2"
 1707:                "~n   ~p", [OptsVals]),
 1708:             ok = gen_udp:send(S1,
 1709:                               {Family,{loopback,P2}}, OptsVals2, <<"PQRST">>),
 1710:             ?SLEEP(100)
 1711:         end,
 1712: 
 1713:     ?P("try recv data on S1"),
 1714:     {ok,{_,P2,<<"klmno">>}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, Timeout),
 1715:     ?P("await message on S2"),
 1716:     receive
 1717:         {udp,S2,_,P1,OptsVals4,<<"pqrst">>} ->
 1718:             ?P("S2 message received: "
 1719:                "~n   OptsVals4: ~p", [OptsVals4]),
 1720:             verify_sets_eq(OptsVals4, OptsVals);
 1721:         Other2 ->
 1722:             exit({unexpected,Other2})
 1723:     after Timeout ->
 1724:             exit(timeout)
 1725:     end,
 1726:     ?P("(maybe, ~p) await message on S2", [TestSend]),
 1727:     TestSend andalso
 1728:         receive
 1729:             {udp, S2, _, P1, OptsVals5, <<"PQRST">>} ->
 1730:                 ?P("S2 message received: "
 1731:                    "~n   OptsVals5: ~p", [OptsVals5]),
 1732:                 verify_sets_eq(OptsVals5, OptsVals2);
 1733:             Other3 ->
 1734:                 exit({unexpected,Other3})
 1735:         after Timeout ->
 1736:                 exit(timeout)
 1737:         end,
 1738: 
 1739:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1740:     ok = gen_udp:close(S1),
 1741:     ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 1742: %%%    exit({{_OSType,_OSVer},success}), % In search for the truth
 1743: 
 1744:     ?P("done"),
 1745:     ok.
 1746: 
 1747: verify_sets_eq(L1, L2) ->
 1748:     L = lists:sort(L1),
 1749:     case lists:sort(L2) of
 1750:         L ->
 1751:             ok;
 1752:         _ ->
 1753:             exit({sets_neq, L1, L2})
 1754:     end.
 1755: 
 1756: 
 1757: local_basic(Config) ->
 1758:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_basic(Config, []) end).
 1759: 
 1760: local_basic_binary(Config) ->
 1761:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_basic(Config, [binary]) end).
 1762: 
 1763: do_local_basic(Config, Opts) ->
 1764:     ?P("begin"),
 1765:     SFile = local_filename(server),
 1766:     SAddr = {local,bin_filename(SFile)},
 1767:     CFile = local_filename(client),
 1768:     CAddr = {local,bin_filename(CFile)},
 1769:     _ = file:delete(SFile),
 1770:     _ = file:delete(CFile),
 1771:     %%
 1772:     ?P("create server socket"),
 1773:     S = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,SFile}},{active,false}|Opts])),
 1774:     ?P("create client socket"),
 1775:     C = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,CFile}},{active,false}|Opts])),
 1776:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1777:     CAddr = ok(inet:sockname(C)),
 1778:     ?P("SockName(s):"
 1779:        "~n   Server: ~p"
 1780:        "~n   Client: ~p", [SAddr, CAddr]),
 1781:     local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, CAddr),
 1782: 
 1783:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1784:     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1785:     ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1786:     %%
 1787:     ok = file:delete(SFile),
 1788:     ok = file:delete(CFile),
 1789:     ?P("end"),
 1790:     ok.
 1791: 
 1792: local_unbound(Config) ->
 1793:     SFile = local_filename(server),
 1794:     SAddr = {local,bin_filename(SFile)},
 1795:     _ = file:delete(SFile),
 1796:     %%
 1797:     S = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,SAddr},{active,false}])),
 1798:     C = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [local,{active,false}])),
 1799:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1800:     local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, undefined),
 1801:     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1802:     ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1803:     %%
 1804:     ok = file:delete(SFile),
 1805:     ok.
 1806: 
 1807: local_fdopen(Config) ->
 1808:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_fdopen(Config) end).
 1809: 
 1810: 
 1811: do_local_fdopen(Config) ->
 1812:     ?P("begin"),
 1813:     SFile = local_filename(server),
 1814:     SAddr = {local,bin_filename(SFile)},
 1815:     CFile = local_filename(client),
 1816:     CAddr = {local,bin_filename(CFile)},
 1817:     _ = file:delete(SFile),
 1818:     _ = file:delete(CFile),
 1819: 
 1820:     %%
 1821:     ?P("try create \"dummy\" (server) socket"),
 1822:     {S0, FD} = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,SAddr},{active,false}]) of
 1823:                    {ok, Sock0} when is_port(Sock0) ->
 1824:                        ?P("(port) try extract FD"),
 1825:                        Fd = ok(prim_inet:getfd(Sock0)),
 1826:                        {Sock0, Fd};
 1827:                    {ok, Sock0} -> % socket
 1828:                        ?P("(socket) try extract FD"),
 1829:                        {ok, [{fd, Fd}]} =
 1830:                            gen_udp_socket:getopts(Sock0, [fd]),
 1831:                        {Sock0, Fd}
 1832:                end,
 1833:     ?P("try create (client) socket"),
 1834:     C  = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,CFile}},{active,false}])),
 1835:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S0)),
 1836:     CAddr = ok(inet:sockname(C)),
 1837:     ?P("try create (server) socket using fd = ~w", [FD]),
 1838:     S  = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{fd, FD}, local, {active,false}])),
 1839:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1840: 
 1841:     ?P("perform handshake"),
 1842:     local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, CAddr),
 1843: 
 1844:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1845:     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1846:     ok = gen_udp:close(S0),
 1847:     ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1848:     %%
 1849:     ok = file:delete(SFile),
 1850:     ok = file:delete(CFile),
 1851:     ?P("done"),
 1852:     ok.
 1853: 
 1854: local_fdopen_unbound(Config) ->
 1855:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_fdopen_unbound(Config) end).
 1856: 
 1857: do_local_fdopen_unbound(Config) ->
 1858:     ?P("begin"),
 1859:     SFile = local_filename(server),
 1860:     SAddr = {local,bin_filename(SFile)},
 1861:     _ = file:delete(SFile),
 1862: 
 1863:     %%
 1864:     ?P("try create (server) socket"),
 1865:     S  = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,SAddr},{active,false}])),
 1866:     ?P("try create \"dummy\" (client) socket"),
 1867:     {C0, FD} = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [local,{active,false}]) of
 1868:                    {ok, Sock0} when is_port(Sock0) ->
 1869:                        ?P("(port) try extract FD"),
 1870:                        Fd = ok(prim_inet:getfd(Sock0)),
 1871:                        {Sock0, Fd};
 1872:                    {ok, Sock0} -> % socket
 1873:                        ?P("(socket) try extract FD"),
 1874:                        {ok, [{fd, Fd}]} =
 1875:                            gen_udp_socket:getopts(Sock0, [fd]),
 1876:                        {Sock0, Fd}
 1877:                end,
 1878:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1879:     ?P("try create (client) socket using fd = ~w", [FD]),
 1880:     C  = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{fd,Fd},local,{active,false}])),
 1881: 
 1882:     ?P("perform handshake"),
 1883:     local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, undefined),
 1884: 
 1885:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1886:     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1887:     ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1888:     ok = gen_udp:close(C0),
 1889:     %%
 1890:     ok = file:delete(SFile),
 1891: 
 1892:     ?P("done"),
 1893:     ok.
 1894: 
 1895: local_abstract(Config) ->
 1896:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_abstract(Config) end).
 1897: 
 1898: do_local_abstract(Config) ->
 1899:     case os:type() of
 1900: 	{unix,linux} ->
 1901:             ?P("create server socket"),
 1902: 	    S = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,<<>>}},{active,false}])),
 1903:             ?P("create client socket"),
 1904: 	    C = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,<<>>}},{active,false}])),
 1905:             ?P("verify sockname(s)"),
 1906: 	    {local,_} = SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1907: 	    {local,_} = CAddr = ok(inet:sockname(C)),
 1908:             ?P("perform handshake"),
 1909: 	    local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, CAddr),
 1910:             ?P("cleanup"),
 1911: 	    ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1912: 	    ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1913:             ?P("done"),
 1914: 	    ok;
 1915: 	_ ->
 1916: 	    {skip, "AF_LOCAL Abstract Addresses only supported on Linux"}
 1917:     end.
 1918: 
 1919: 
 1920: local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, CAddr) ->
 1921:     SData = "9876543210",
 1922:     CData = "0123456789",
 1923:     ?P("try (client) send"),
 1924:     ok = gen_udp:send(C, SAddr, 0, CData),
 1925:     ?P("try (server) recv"),
 1926:     CData1 = local_handshake_data(C, CData),
 1927:     case ok(gen_tcp:recv(S, 112)) of
 1928: 	{{unspec,<<>>}, 0, CData1} when CAddr =:= undefined ->
 1929: 	    ok;
 1930: 	{{local,<<>>}, 0, CData1} when CAddr =:= undefined ->
 1931: 	    ok;
 1932: 	{CAddr, 0, CData1} when CAddr =/= undefined ->
 1933: 	    ok = gen_udp:send(S, CAddr, 0, SData),
 1934:             SData1 = local_handshake_data(S, SData),
 1935: 	    {SAddr, 0, SData1} = ok(gen_tcp:recv(C, 112)),
 1936: 	    ok
 1937: 
 1938:     end.
 1939: 
 1940: local_handshake_data(S, Data) when is_list(Data) ->
 1941:     case inet:getopts(S, [mode]) of
 1942:         {ok,[{mode,binary}]} ->
 1943:             list_to_binary(Data);
 1944:         {ok,[{mode,list}]} ->
 1945:             Data
 1946:     end.
 1947: 
 1948: 
 1949: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
 1950: %% Open a passive socket. Create a socket that reads from it.
 1951: %% Then close the socket.
 1952: recv_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1953:     ?P("begin"),
 1954:     {ok, Sock} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{active, false}]),
 1955:     RECV = fun() ->
 1956:                    ?P("try recv"),
 1957:                    Res = gen_udp:recv(Sock, 0),
 1958:                    ?P("recv res: ~p", [Res]),
 1959:                    exit(Res)
 1960:            end,
 1961:     ?P("spawn reader"),
 1962:     {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(RECV),
 1963:     receive
 1964:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, PreReason} ->
 1965:             %% Make sure id does not die for some other reason...
 1966:             ct:fail("Unexpected pre close from reader (~p): ~p",
 1967:                           [Pid, PreReason])
 1968:     after 5000 -> % Just in case...
 1969:             ok
 1970:     end,
 1971:     ?P("close socket"),
 1972:     ok = gen_udp:close(Sock),
 1973:     ?P("await reader termination"),
 1974:     receive
 1975:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, {error, closed}} ->
 1976:             ?P("expected reader termination result"),
 1977:             ok;
 1978:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, PostReason} ->
