 1979:             ?P("unexpected reader termination: ~p", [PostReason]),
 1980:             ct:fail("Unexpected post close from reader (~p): ~p",
 1981:                           [Pid, PostReason])
 1982:     after 5000 ->
 1983:             ?P("unexpected reader termination timeout"),
 1984:             demonitor(MRef, [flush]),
 1985:             exit(Pid, kill),
 1986:             ct:fail("Reader (~p) termination timeout", [Pid])
 1987:     end,
 1988:     ?P("done"),
 1989:     ok.
 1990: 
 1991: 
 1992: 
 1993: 
 1994: %% Test that connect/3 has effect.
 1995: connect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1996:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1997:             fun() -> do_connect(Config) end).
 1998: 
 1999: do_connect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2000:     ?P("begin"),
 2001:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
 2002:     ?P("try create first socket"),
 2003:     {ok, S1} = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
 2004:     {ok, P1} = inet:port(S1),
 2005:     ?P("try create second socket"),
 2006:     {ok, S2} = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
 2007:     ?P("try set second socket active: false: "
 2008:        "~n   ~p", [inet:info(S2)]),
 2009:     ok = inet:setopts(S2, [{active, false}]),
 2010:     ?P("try close first socket"),
 2011:     ok = gen_udp:close(S1),
 2012: 
 2013:     %% Test if this helps...
 2014:     ?P("sleep some"),
 2015:     ct:sleep({seconds, 5}),
 2016: 
 2017:     case os:type() of
 2018: 	{win32, nt} ->
 2019: 	    ok;
 2020: 	_ ->
 2021: 	    ?P("try some doomed connect targets: ~p", [P1]),
 2022: 	    {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:connect(S2, "", ?CLOSED_PORT),
 2023: 	    {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:connect(S2, '', ?CLOSED_PORT),
 2024: 	    {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:connect(S2, ".", ?CLOSED_PORT),
 2025: 	    {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:connect(S2, '.', ?CLOSED_PORT),
 2026: 	    ok
 2027:     end,
 2028: 
 2029:     ?P("try connect second socket to: ~p, ~p", [Addr, P1]),
 2030:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S2, Addr, P1),
 2031:     ?P("try send on second socket"),
 2032:     ok = gen_udp:send(S2, <<16#deadbeef:32>>),
 2033:     ?P("try recv on second socket - expect failure when"
 2034:        "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [inet:info(S2)]),
 2035: 
 2036:     %% Need this for the error handling
 2037:     OS = which_os(),
 2038: 
 2039:     ok = inet:setopts(S2, [{debug, true}]),
 2040:     ok = case gen_udp:recv(S2, 0, 500) of
 2041: 	     {error, econnrefused = R} ->
 2042:                  ?P("expected failure: ~w", [R]),
 2043:                  ok;
 2044: 	     {error, econnreset   = R} ->
 2045:                  ?P("expected failure: ~w", [R]),
 2046:                  ok;
 2047:              {error, timeout      = R} when (OS =:= darwin) ->
 2048:                  ?P("expected failure (~w) on darwin => SKIP", [R]),
 2049:                  (catch gen_udp:close(S2)),
 2050:                  skip(R);
 2051: 	     Other -> 
 2052:                  ?P("UNEXPECTED failure: ~p:"
 2053:                     "~n   ~p", [Other, inet:info(S2)]),
 2054:                  (catch gen_udp:close(S2)),
 2055:                  Other
 2056: 	 end,
 2057: 
 2058:     ?P("cleanup"),
 2059:     (catch gen_udp:close(S2)),
 2060: 
 2061:     ?P("done"),
 2062:     ok.
 2063: 
 2064: 
 2065: 
 2066: reconnect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2067:     Cond = fun() -> is_not_windows() end,
 2068:     Pre  = fun() ->
 2069:                    Addr = {127, 0, 0, 1},
 2070:                    case open_port_0(Config,
 2071:                                     [{debug, true}]) of
 2072:                        {ok, {S, Port}} ->
 2073:                            ?P("[unix] Socket opened: "
 2074:                               "~n   Socket:      ~p"
 2075:                               "~n   socket info: ~p"
 2076:                               "~n   SockName:    ~s"
 2077:                               "~n   PeerName:    ~s",
 2078:                               [S, inet:info(S), sn(S), pn(S)]),
 2079:                            #{local_addr => Addr,
 2080:                              socket     => S,
 2081:                              port       => Port};
 2082:                        {error, Reason} ->
 2083:                            skip(?F("Failed open initial port: "
 2084:                                    "~p", [Reason]))
 2085:                    end
 2086:            end,
 2087:     TC   = fun(State) -> do_reconnect(State) end,
 2088:     Post = fun(#{socket := S}) -> ok = gen_udp:close(S) end,
 2089:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2090:             Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2091: 
 2092: do_reconnect(#{local_addr := Addr,
 2093:                socket     := S,
 2094:                port       := Port}) ->
 2095:     XtrnAddr = {8,8,8,8},
 2096:     DestPort = 53,
 2097:     %% Connect to a local destination
 2098:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S, Addr, DestPort),
 2099:     ?P("Socket connected: "
 2100:        "~n   socket info: ~p"
 2101:        "~n   SockName:    ~s"
 2102:        "~n   PeerName:    ~s", [inet:info(S), sn(S), pn(S)]),
 2103:     {ok, {Addr,      DestPort}} = inet:peername(S),
 2104:     {ok, {LocalAddr, Port}}     = inet:sockname(S),
 2105: 
 2106:     %% Reconnect to external destination
 2107:     ?P("try (re-)connect to (external): ~s", [atos({XtrnAddr, DestPort})]),
 2108:     case gen_udp:connect(S, XtrnAddr, DestPort) of
 2109:         ok ->
 2110:             ok;
 2111:         {error, Reason} ->
 2112:             ?P("Failed (re-)connect to external destination:"
 2113:                "~n   Extern Dest: ~s"
 2114:                "~n   Reason:      ~p", [atos({XtrnAddr, DestPort}), Reason]),
 2115:             ct:fail({extern_reconnect, Reason})
 2116:     end,
 2117:     ?P("Socket (re-)connected: "
 2118:        "~n   socket info: ~p"
 2119:        "~n   SockName:    ~s"
 2120:        "~n   PeerName:    ~s", [inet:info(S), sn(S), pn(S)]),
 2121:     {ok, {XtrnAddr,     DestPort}} = inet:peername(S),
 2122:     {ok, {RoutableAddr, Port}}     = inet:sockname(S),
 2123: 
 2124:     ?P("verify socket (routable) addr: ~p", [RoutableAddr]),
 2125:     %% We should have a non-loopback address here
 2126:     true = RoutableAddr =/= LocalAddr,
 2127: 
 2128:     %% Reconnect to local addr
 2129:     ?P("(re-)connect to local address: ~s", [atos({Addr, DestPort})]),
 2130:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S, Addr, DestPort),
 2131:     ?P("Socket (re-)connected: "
 2132:        "~n   socket info: ~p"
 2133:        "~n   SockName:    ~s"
 2134:        "~n   PeerName:    ~s", [inet:info(S), sn(S), pn(S)]),
 2135:     {ok, {Addr,      DestPort}} = inet:peername(S),
 2136:     {ok, {LocalAddr, Port}}     = inet:sockname(S),
 2137: 
 2138:     ?P("done"),
 2139:     ok.
 2140: 
 2141: pn(S) ->
 2142:     case inet:peername(S) of
 2143:         {ok, Addr} ->
 2144:             atos(Addr);
 2145:         {error, _} ->
 2146:             "undefined"
 2147:     end.
 2148: 
 2149: sn(S) ->
 2150:     case inet:sockname(S) of
 2151:         {ok, Addr} ->
 2152:             atos(Addr);
 2153:         {error, _} ->
 2154:             "undefined"
 2155:     end.
 2156: 
 2157: atos({A, P}) when is_tuple(A) andalso is_integer(P) ->
 2158:     ?F("~s:~w", [inet_parse:ntoa(A), P]).
 2159:             
 2160: %% For Linux to keep the port when we reconnect;
 2161: %% we need to first bind to a specific port.
 2162: %% If we bind to port 0 and get an ephemeral port
 2163: %% it apparently can change when we reconnect to a different
 2164: %% destination depending on routing and interfaces.
 2165: %%
 2166: %% I consider this a workaround for a Linux bug,
 2167: %% ironically in a test case that tests
 2168: %% a workaround for another Linux bug (related)...
 2169: %%
 2170: open_port_0(Config, Opts) ->
 2171:     open_port_0(Config, 0, Opts, 10).
 2172: %%
 2173: open_port_0(Config, Port, Opts, N) ->
 2174:     case ?OPEN(Config, Port, Opts) of
 2175:         {ok, S} ->
 2176:             if
 2177:                 Port =:= 0 ->
 2178:                     {ok, Port_1} = inet:port(S),
 2179:                     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 2180:                     %% Speculate that we can open a socket with that port
 2181:                     open_port_0(Config, Port_1, Opts, N);
 2182:                 true ->
 2183:                     ?P("Socket port: ~w", [Port]),
 2184:                     {ok, {S, Port}}
 2185:             end;
 2186:         {error, eaddrinuse} when Port =/= 0 ->
 2187:             open_port_0(Config, 0, Opts, N - 1);
 2188:         {error, _} = Error ->
 2189:             Error
 2190:     end.
 2191: 
 2192: 
 2193: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2194: 
 2195: implicit_inet6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2196:     ?TC_TRY(implicit_inet6, fun() -> do_implicit_inet6(Config) end).
 2197: 
 2198: do_implicit_inet6(Config) ->
 2199:     Host = ok(inet:gethostname()),
 2200:     case inet:getaddr(Host, inet6) of
 2201: 	{ok, {16#fe80,0,0,0,_,_,_,_} = Addr} ->
 2202: 	     ?SKIPT("Got link local IPv6 address: "
 2203:                     ++inet:ntoa(Addr));
 2204: 	{ok, Addr} ->
 2205: 	    implicit_inet6(Config, Host, Addr);
 2206: 	{error, Reason} ->
 2207: 	    ?SKIPT("Can not look up IPv6 address: "
 2208:                    ++atom_to_list(Reason))
 2209:     end.
 2210: 
 2211: implicit_inet6(Config, Host, Addr) ->
 2212:     Active   = {active,false},
 2213:     Loopback = {0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1},
 2214:     ?P("try 1 with explicit inet6 on loopback"),
 2215:     S1 = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [inet6, Active, {ip, Loopback}]) of
 2216:              {ok, Sock1} ->
 2217:                  Sock1;
 2218:              {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason1} ->
 2219:                  ?SKIPT(open_failed_str(Reason1));
 2220:              _ ->
 2221:                  ?SKIPT("IPv6 not supported")
 2222:          end,
 2223:     implicit_inet6(Config, S1, Active, Loopback),
 2224:     ok = gen_udp:close(S1),
 2225: 
 2226:     %%
 2227:     Localaddr = ok(get_localaddr()),
 2228:     ?P("try 2 on local addr (~p)", [Localaddr]),
 2229:     S2 = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Localaddr}, Active]) of
 2230:              {ok, Sock2} ->
 2231:                  Sock2;
 2232:              {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason2} ->
 2233:                  ?SKIPT(open_failed_str(Reason2))
 2234:          end,
 2235:     implicit_inet6(Config, S2, Active, Localaddr),
 2236:     ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 2237: 
 2238:     %%
 2239:     ?P("try 3 on addr ~p (~p)", [Addr, Host]),
 2240:     S3 = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr, Addr}, Active]) of
 2241:              {ok, Sock3} ->
 2242:                  Sock3;
 2243:              {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason3} ->
 2244:                  ?SKIPT(open_failed_str(Reason3))
 2245:          end,
 2246:     implicit_inet6(Config, S3, Active, Addr),
 2247:     ok = gen_udp:close(S3),
 2248:     ok.
 2249: 
 2250: implicit_inet6(Config, S1, Active, Addr) ->
 2251:     ?P("get (\"local\") port number"),
 2252:     P1 = ok(inet:port(S1)),
 2253:     ?P("open \"remote\" socket"),
 2254:     S2 = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [inet6, Active]) of
 2255:              {ok, Sock2} ->
 2256:                  Sock2;
 2257:              {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason3} ->
 2258:                  ?SKIPT(open_failed_str(Reason3))
 2259:          end,
 2260:     ?P("get (\"remote\") port number"),
 2261:     P2 = ok(inet:port(S2)),
 2262:     ?P("connect (\"remote\") socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2263:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S2, Addr, P1),
 2264:     ?P("connect (\"local\") socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P2]),
 2265:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S1, Addr, P2),
 2266:     ?P("peername of \"local\" socket"),
 2267:     {Addr,P2} = ok(inet:peername(S1)),
 2268:     ?P("peername of \"remote\" socket"),
 2269:     {Addr,P1} = ok(inet:peername(S2)),
 2270:     ?P("sockname of \"local\" socket"),
 2271:     {Addr,P1} = ok(inet:sockname(S1)),
 2272:     ?P("sockname of \"remote\" socket"),
 2273:     {Addr,P2} = ok(inet:sockname(S2)),
 2274:     ?P("send ping on \"local\" socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P2]),
 2275:     %% On some platforms its allowed to specify address and port
 2276:     %% (that is; when useing sendto) *even* if the socket is connected
 2277:     %% (assuming the send destination is the same as connected destination).
 2278:     %% But on other platforms, e.g. FreeBSD, this is *not* allowed!
 2279:     %% Linux:
 2280:     %%   EISCONN
 2281:     %%      The connection-mode socket was connected already but a recipient
 2282:     %%      was specified. (Now either this error is returned, or the re-
 2283:     %%      cipient specification is ignored.)
 2284:     %% FreeBSD:
 2285:     %%   [EISCONN]    A destination address was specified and the socket is
 2286:     %%                already connected.
 2287:     case gen_udp:send(S1, Addr, P2, "ping") of
 2288:         ok ->
 2289:             ?P("recv ping on \"remote\" socket (from ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2290:             {Addr,P1,"ping"} = ok(gen_udp:recv(S2, 1024, 1000)),
 2291:             ?P("send pong on \"remote\" socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2292:             ok = gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P1, "pong"),
 2293:             ?P("recv ping on \"local\" socket (from ~p:~p)", [Addr, P2]),
 2294:             {Addr,P2,"pong"} = ok(gen_udp:recv(S1, 1024)),
 2295:             ?P("close \"remote\" socket"),
 2296:             ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 2297:             ok;
 2298:         {error, eisconn} ->
 2299:             ?P("socket is connect => *not* allowed to use sendto"),
 2300:             ok = gen_udp:send(S1, "ping"),
 2301:             %% Not allowed to specify address *at all* for a connected socket
 2302:             ?P("recv ping on \"remote\" socket (from ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2303:             {Addr,P1,"ping"} = ok(gen_udp:recv(S2, 1024, 1000)),
 2304:             ?P("send pong on \"remote\" socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2305:             ok = gen_udp:send(S2, "pong"),
 2306:             ?P("recv ping on \"local\" socket (from ~p:~p)", [Addr, P2]),
 2307:             {Addr,P2,"pong"} = ok(gen_udp:recv(S1, 1024)),
 2308:             ?P("close \"remote\" socket"),
 2309:             ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 2310:             ok
 2311:     end.
 2312: 
 2313: 
 2314: 
 2315: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2316: 
 2317: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2318: %% We create a socket, then spawns processes that create
 2319: %% monitors to it...
 2320: socket_monitor1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2321:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2322:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor1,
 2323:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor1(Config) end).
 2324: 
 2325: do_socket_monitor1(Config) ->
 2326:     ?P("begin"),
 2327:     Self         = self(),
 2328:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2329:     {ok, Sock1} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2330:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2331:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 2332: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 2333: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2334: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2335: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 2336: 	 end,
 2337:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2338:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1),
 2339:     ?P("await client ready"),
 2340:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2341:     ?P("close socket"),
 2342:     gen_udp:close(Sock1),
 2343:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2344:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2345:     ?P("done"),
 2346:     ok.
 2347: 
 2348: sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType) ->
 2349:     sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, "client").
 2350: 
 2351: sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, Name) ->
 2352:     receive
 2353: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) andalso 
 2354: 					     (Mon  =:= ExpMon)  andalso 
 2355: 					     (Sock =:= ExpSock) ->
 2356: 	    ?P("[~s] received expected (socket) down message: "
 2357: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 2358: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 2359: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 2360: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 2361: 	    exit(ok);
 2362: 
 2363: 	Any ->
 2364: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected message: "
 2365: 	       "~n   ~p", [Name, Any]),
 2366: 	    exit({unexpected_message, Any})
 2367:     end.
 2368: 
 2369: sm_await_client_ready(Pid) ->
 2370:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid, "client").
 2371: 
 2372: sm_await_client_ready(Pid, Name) ->
 2373:     receive
 2374: 	{Pid, ready} ->
 2375: 	    ?P("received ~s ready", [Name])
 2376:     end.
 2377: 
 2378: sm_await_down(Pid, Mon, ExpRes) ->
 2379:     receive
 2380: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, ExpRes} ->
 2381: 	    ?P("received expected process down message from ~p", [Pid]),
 2382: 	    ok;
 2383: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, UnexpRes} ->
 2384: 	    ?P("received unexpected process down message from ~p: "
 2385: 	       "~n   ~p", [Pid, UnexpRes]),
 2386: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_down, UnexpRes})
 2387:     end.
 2388: 
 2389: 
 2390: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2391: 
 2392: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2393: %% We create "many" socket(s), then spawn processes that create
 2394: %% monitors to them...
 2395: socket_monitor1_manys(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2396:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2397:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor1_manys,
 2398:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor1_manys(Config) end).
 2399: 
 2400: do_socket_monitor1_manys(Config) ->
 2401:     ?P("begin"),
 2402:     Self         = self(),
 2403:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2404:     ?P("[client] create socket(s)"),
 2405:     {ok, Sock1} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2406:     {ok, Sock2} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2407:     {ok, Sock3} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2408:     {ok, Sock4} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2409:     {ok, Sock5} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2410:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2411:     F1 = fun(Sockets, Parent) when is_list(Sockets) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 2412: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor(s)"),
 2413: 		 Monitors = [{inet:monitor(Socket), Socket} ||
 2414: 				Socket <- Sockets],
 2415: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2416: 		 sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, Type)
 2417: 	 end,
 2418:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2419:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F([Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5], F1),
 2420:     ?P("await client ready"),
 2421:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2422:     ?P("close socket(s)"),
 2423:     gen_udp:close(Sock1),
 2424:     gen_udp:close(Sock2),
 2425:     gen_udp:close(Sock3),
 2426:     gen_udp:close(Sock4),
 2427:     gen_udp:close(Sock5),
 2428:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2429:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2430:     ?P("done"),
 2431:     ok.
 2432: 
 2433: 
 2434: sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, ExpType) ->
 2435:     sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, ExpType, "client").
 2436: 
 2437: sm_await_socket_down2([], _ExpType, Name) ->
 2438:     ?P("[~s] all sockets down", [Name]),
 2439:     exit(ok);
 2440: sm_await_socket_down2(Mons, ExpType, Name) when is_list(Mons) ->
 2441:     ?P("[~s] await socket down", [Name]),
 2442:     receive
 2443: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) ->
 2444: 	    ?P("[~s] received expected (socket) down message: "
 2445: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 2446: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 2447: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 2448: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 2449: 	    case lists:keysearch(Mon, 1, Mons) of
 2450: 		{value, {Mon, Sock}} ->
 2451: 		    Mons2 = lists:keydelete(Mon, 1, Mons),
 2452: 		    sm_await_socket_down2(Mons2, ExpType, Name);
 2453: 		{value, Value} ->
 2454: 		    ?P("[~s] Unexpected socket down: "
 2455: 		       "~n   Value: ~p", [Name, Value]),
 2456: 		    ct:fail({unexpected_monitor, Mon, Value});
 2457: 		false ->
 2458: 		    ct:fail({unknown_monitor, Mon})
 2459: 	    end
 2460:     end.
 2461: 
 2462: 
 2463: 
 2464: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2465: 
 2466: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2467: %% We create a socket, then spawn client process(es) that create
 2468: %% monitors to it...
 2469: socket_monitor1_manyc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2470:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2471:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor1_manyc,
 2472:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor1_manyc(Config) end).
 2473: 
 2474: do_socket_monitor1_manyc(Config) ->
 2475:     ?P("begin"),
 2476:     Self         = self(),
 2477:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2478:     {ok, Sock1}  = ?OPEN(Config),
 2479:     F  = fun(S, Fun, Name) ->
 2480: 		 spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Name, Self) end)
 2481: 	 end,
 2482:     F1 = fun(Socket, Name, Parent) when is_list(Name) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 2483: 		 ?P("[~s] monitor socket", [Name]),
 2484: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2485: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2486: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 2487: 	 end,
 2488:     ?P("spawn client(s)"),
 2489:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1, "client1"),
 2490:     {Pid2, Mon2} = F(Sock1, F1, "client2"),
 2491:     {Pid3, Mon3} = F(Sock1, F1, "client3"),
 2492:     {Pid4, Mon4} = F(Sock1, F1, "client4"),
 2493:     {Pid5, Mon5} = F(Sock1, F1, "client5"),
 2494:     ?P("await client(s) ready"),
 2495:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1, "client1"),
 2496:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid2, "client2"),
 2497:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid3, "client3"),
 2498:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid4, "client4"),
 2499:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid5, "client5"),
 2500:     ?P("close socket"),
 2501:     gen_udp:close(Sock1),
 2502:     ?P("await client(s) termination"),
 2503:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2504:     sm_await_down(Pid2, Mon2, ok),
 2505:     sm_await_down(Pid3, Mon3, ok),
 2506:     sm_await_down(Pid4, Mon4, ok),
 2507:     sm_await_down(Pid5, Mon5, ok),
 2508:     ?P("done"),
 2509:     ok.
 2510: 
 2511: 
 2512: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2513: 
 2514: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2515: %% We create a socket, then spawns processes that create
 2516: %% monitors to it...
 2517: socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2518:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2519:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor1_demon_after,
 2520:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config) end).
 2521: 
 2522: do_socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config) ->
 2523:     ?P("begin"),
 2524:     Self         = self(),
 2525:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2526:     {ok, Sock1}  = ?OPEN(Config),
 2527:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2528:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 2529: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 2530: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2531: 		 ?P("[client] sleep some"),
 2532: 		 ?SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 2533: 		 ?P("[client] cancel (socket) monitor"),
 2534: 		 inet:cancel_monitor(MRef),
 2535: 		 ?P("[client] announce ready"),
 2536: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2537: 		 sm_await_no_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 2538: 	 end,
 2539:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2540:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1),
 2541:     ?P("await client ready"),
 2542:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2543:     ?P("close socket"),
 2544:     gen_udp:close(Sock1),
 2545:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2546:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2547:     ?P("done"),
 2548:     ok.
 2549: 
 2550: 
 2551: sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType) ->
 2552:     sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, "client").
 2553: 
 2554: sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, Name) ->
 2555:     receive
 2556: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) andalso 
 2557: 					     (Mon  =:= ExpMon)  andalso 
 2558: 					     (Sock =:= ExpSock) ->
 2559: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected (socket) down message: "
 2560: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 2561: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 2562: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 2563: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 2564: 	    exit({unexpected_down, Mon, Type, Sock, Info});
 2565: 
 2566: 	Any ->
 2567: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected message: "
 2568: 	       "~n   ~p", [Name, Any]),
 2569: 	    exit({unexpected_message, Any})
 2570: 
 2571:     after 1000 ->
 2572: 	    ?P("[~s] expected message timeout", [Name]),
 2573: 	    exit(ok)
 2574:     end.
 2575: 
 2576: 
 2577: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2578: 
 2579: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2580: %% Spawn a process that creates a socket, then spawns processes
 2581: %% that create monitors to it...
 2582: socket_monitor2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2583:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2584:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor2,
 2585:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor2(Config) end).
 2586: 
 2587: do_socket_monitor2(Config) ->
 2588:     ?P("begin"),
 2589:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2590:     Self         = self(),
 2591:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 2592: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 2593: 			      ?P("[owner] create (listen) socket"),
 2594: 			      {ok, S} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2595: 			      ?P("[owner] send socket to ctrl"),
 2596: 			      Self ! {socket, S},
 2597: 			      ?P("[owner] ready"),
 2598: 			      receive
 2599: 				  {Self, die} ->
 2600: 				      exit(normal)
 2601: 			      end
 2602: 		      end),
 2603:     Sock1 = receive
 2604:                 {socket, S} ->
 2605:                     ?P("received socket from owner"),
 2606:                     S;
 2607:                 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 2608:                     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 2609:                        "~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 2610:                     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 2611: 	     end,
 2612:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2613:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 2614: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 2615: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2616: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2617: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 2618: 	 end,
 2619:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2620:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1),
 2621:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2622:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2623:     ?P("kill owner"),
 2624:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 2625:     ?P("await owner termination"),
 2626:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 2627:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2628:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2629:     ?P("done"),
 2630:     ok.
 2631: 
 2632: 
 2633: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2634: 
 2635: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2636: %% Spawn a process that creates "many" socket(s), then spawns
 2637: %% a process that create monitors to them...
 2638: 
 2639: socket_monitor2_manys(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2640:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2641:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor2_manys,
 2642:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor2_manys(Config) end).
 2643: 
 2644: do_socket_monitor2_manys(Config) ->
 2645:     ?P("begin"),
 2646:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2647:     Self         = self(),
 2648:     ?P("spawn owner"),
 2649:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 2650: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 2651: 			      ?P("[owner] create (listen) socket(s)"),
 2652: 			      {ok, S1} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2653: 			      {ok, S2} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2654: 			      {ok, S3} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2655: 			      {ok, S4} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2656: 			      {ok, S5} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2657: 			      ?P("[owner] send (listen) socket(s) to ctrl"),
 2658: 			      Self ! {socket, [S1, S2, S3, S4, S5]},
 2659: 			      ?P("[owner] ready"),
 2660: 			      receive
 2661: 				  {Self, die} ->
 2662: 				      exit(normal)
 2663: 			      end
 2664: 		      end),
 2665:     ?P("await sockets (from owner)"),
 2666:     Socks = receive
 2667:                 {socket, Ss} ->
 2668:                     ?P("received socket(s) from owner"),
 2669:                     Ss;
 2670:                 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 2671:                     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 2672:                        "~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 2673:                     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 2674:             end,
 2675:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2676:     F1 = fun(Sockets, Parent) when is_list(Sockets) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 2677: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor(s)"),
 2678: 		 Monitors = [{inet:monitor(Socket), Socket} ||
 2679: 				Socket <- Sockets],
 2680: 		 ?P("[client] announce ready"),
 2681: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2682: 		 sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, Type)
 2683: 	 end,
 2684:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2685:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Socks, F1),
 2686:     ?P("await client ready"),
 2687:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2688:     ?P("kill owner"),
 2689:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 2690:     ?P("await owner (~p) termination", [OwnerPid]),
 2691:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 2692:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2693:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2694:     ?P("done"),
 2695:     ok.
 2696: 
 2697: 
 2698: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2699: 
 2700: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2701: %% Spawn a process that creates a socket, then spawns (client)
 2702: %% processes that create monitors to it...
 2703: socket_monitor2_manyc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2704:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2705:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor2_manyc,
 2706:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor2_manyc(Config) end).
 2707: 
 2708: do_socket_monitor2_manyc(Config) ->
 2709:     ?P("begin"),
 2710:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2711:     Self         = self(),
 2712:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 2713: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 2714: 			      {ok, S} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2715: 			      Self ! {socket, S},
 2716: 			      receive
 2717: 				  {Self, die} ->
 2718: 				      exit(normal)
 2719: 			      end
 2720: 		      end),
 2721:     Sock1 = receive
 2722: 		 {socket, S} ->
 2723: 		     ?P("received socket from owner"),
 2724: 		     S;
 2725: 		 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 2726: 		     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 2727: 			"~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 2728: 		     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 2729: 	     end,
 2730:     F  = fun(S, Fun, Name) ->
 2731: 		 spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Name, Self) end)
 2732: 	 end,
 2733:     F1 = fun(Socket, Name, Parent) when is_list(Name) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 2734: 		 ?P("[~s] create monitor", [Name]),
 2735: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2736: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2737: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type, Name)
 2738: 	 end,
 2739:     ?P("spawn client(s)"),
 2740:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1, "client1"),
 2741:     {Pid2, Mon2} = F(Sock1, F1, "client2"),
 2742:     {Pid3, Mon3} = F(Sock1, F1, "client3"),
 2743:     {Pid4, Mon4} = F(Sock1, F1, "client4"),
 2744:     {Pid5, Mon5} = F(Sock1, F1, "client5"),
 2745:     ?P("await client(s) ready"),
 2746:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1, "client1"),
 2747:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid2, "client2"),
 2748:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid3, "client3"),
 2749:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid4, "client4"),
 2750:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid5, "client5"),
 2751:     ?P("kill owner"),
 2752:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 2753:     ?P("await owner termination"),
 2754:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 2755:     ?P("await client(s) termination"),
 2756:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2757:     sm_await_down(Pid2, Mon2, ok),
 2758:     sm_await_down(Pid3, Mon3, ok),
 2759:     sm_await_down(Pid4, Mon4, ok),
 2760:     sm_await_down(Pid5, Mon5, ok),
 2761:     ?P("done"),
 2762:     ok.
 2763:

 2766: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2767: 
 2768: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2769: %% Spawn a process that creates a socket, then spawns (client)
 2770: %% processes that create monitors to it...
 2771: otp_17492(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2772:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2773:     ?TC_TRY(otp_17492, fun() -> do_otp_17492(Config) end).
 2774: 
 2775: do_otp_17492(Config) ->
 2776:     ?P("begin"),
 2777: 
 2778:     Self = self(),
 2779: 
 2780:     ?P("try create socket"),
 2781:     {ok, L} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, []),
 2782: 
 2783:     ?P("try get (created) socket info"),
 2784:     try inet:info(L) of
 2785: 	#{owner := Owner} = Info when is_pid(Owner) andalso (Owner =:= Self) ->
 2786: 	    ?P("(created) socket info: ~p", [Info]);
 2787: 	OBadInfo ->
 2788: 	    ?P("(created) socket info: ~p", [OBadInfo]),
 2789: 	    (catch gen_udp:close(L)),
 2790: 	    ct:fail({invalid_created_info, OBadInfo})
 2791:     catch
 2792: 	OC:OE:OS ->
 2793: 	    ?P("Failed get (created) Listen socket info: "
 2794: 	       "~n   Class: ~p"
 2795: 	       "~n   Error: ~p"
 2796: 	       "~n   Stack: ~p", [OC, OE, OS]),
 2797: 	    (catch gen_udp:close(L)),
 2798: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_created_info_result, {OC, OE, OS}})
 2799:     end,
 2800: 
 2801:     ?P("try close socket"),
 2802:     ok = gen_udp:close(L),
 2803: 
 2804:     ?P("try get (closed) socket info"),
 2805:     try inet:info(L) of
 2806: 	#{states := [closed]} = CInfo when is_port(L) ->
 2807: 	    ?P("(closed) socket info: "
 2808: 	       "~n   ~p", [CInfo]);
 2809: 	#{rstates := [closed], wstates := [closed]} = CInfo ->
 2810: 	    ?P("(closed) socket info: "
 2811: 	       "~n   ~p", [CInfo]);
 2812: 	CBadInfo ->
 2813: 	    ?P("(closed) socket info: ~p", [CBadInfo]),
 2814: 	    ct:fail({invalid_closed_info, CBadInfo})
 2815:     catch
 2816: 	CC:CE:CS ->
 2817: 	    ?P("Failed get (closed) socket info: "
 2818: 	       "~n   Class: ~p"
 2819: 	       "~n   Error: ~p"
 2820: 	       "~n   Stack: ~p", [CC, CE, CS]),
 2821: 	    (catch gen_udp:close(L)),
 2822: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_closed_info_result, {CC, CE, CS}})
 2823:     end,
 2824: 
 2825:     ?P("done"),
 2826:     ok.
 2827: 
 2828: 
 2829: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2830: 
 2831: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2832: 
 2833: %% Here we use socket:sockaddr_in6() when creating and using the
 2834: %% socket(s).
 2835: %%
 2836: t_simple_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2837:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2838:             fun() -> ?LIB:has_support_ipv6() end,
 2839:             fun() ->
 2840:                     Domain = inet6,
 2841:                     LocalAddr =
 2842:                         case ?LIB:which_local_addr(Domain) of
 2843:                             {ok, LA} ->
 2844:                                 LA;
 2845:                         {error, _} ->
 2846:                             skip("No local address")
 2847:                     end,
 2848:                     SockAddr = #{family   => Domain,
 2849:                                  addr     => LocalAddr,
 2850:                                  port     => 0},
 2851:                     do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(SockAddr, Config)
 2852:             end).
 2853: 
 2854: 
 2855: t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2856:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2857:             fun() ->
 2858:                     ?LIB:has_support_ipv6(),
 2859:                     is_net_supported(),
 2860:                     is_not_darwin()
 2861:             end,
 2862:             fun() ->
 2863:                     Domain = inet6,
 2864:                     LinkLocalAddr =
 2865:                         case ?LIB:which_link_local_addr(Domain) of
 2866:                             {ok, LLA} ->
 2867:                                 ?P("found link local address: "
 2868:                                    "~n   ~p", [LLA]),
 2869:                                 LLA;
 2870:                             {error, _} ->
 2871:                                 skip("No link local address")
 2872:                         end,
 2873:                     Filter =
 2874:                         fun(#{addr := #{family := D,
 2875:                                         addr   := A}} = C) ->
 2876:                                 if 
 2877:                                     (D =:= Domain) andalso
 2878:                                     (A =:= LinkLocalAddr) ->
 2879:                                         ?P("found link-local candidate: "
 2880:                                            "~n   ~p", [C]),
 2881:                                         true;
 2882:                                     true ->
 2883:                                         false
 2884:                                 end;
 2885:                            (_) ->
 2886:                                 false
 2887:                         end,
 2888:                     case net:getifaddrs(Filter) of
 2889:                         {ok, [#{addr := #{scope_id := ScopeID}}=H|T]} ->
 2890:                             ?P("found link-local candidate(s): "
 2891:                                "~n   Candidate:      ~p"
 2892:                                "~n   Rest Candidate: ~p", [H, T]),
 2893:                             SockAddr = #{family   => Domain,
 2894:                                          addr     => LinkLocalAddr,
 2895:                                          port     => 0,
 2896:                                          scope_id => ScopeID},
 2897:                             do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(SockAddr, Config);
 2898:                         {ok, _} ->
 2899:                             skip("Scope ID not found");
 2900:                         {error, R} ->
 2901:                             skip({failed_getifaddrs, R})
 2902:                     end
 2903:             end).
 2904: 
 2905: t_simple_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2906:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2907:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2908:             fun() -> ok end,
 2909:             fun() ->
 2910:                     Domain = inet,
 2911:                     LocalAddr =
 2912:                         case ?LIB:which_local_addr(Domain) of
 2913:                             {ok, LA} ->
 2914:                                 LA;
 2915:                         {error, _} ->
 2916:                             skip("No local address")
 2917:                     end,
 2918:                     SockAddr = #{family   => Domain,
 2919:                                  addr     => LocalAddr,
 2920:                                  port     => 0},
 2921:                     do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(SockAddr, Config)
 2922:             end).
 2923: 
 2924: t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2925:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2926:             fun() -> ok end,
 2927:             fun() ->
 2928:                     Domain = inet,
 2929:                     LinkLocalAddr =
 2930:                         case ?LIB:which_link_local_addr(Domain) of
 2931:                             {ok, LLA} ->
 2932:                                 LLA;
 2933:                             {error, _} ->
 2934:                                 skip("No link local address")
 2935:                         end,
 2936:                     SockAddr = #{family => Domain,
 2937:                                  addr   => LinkLocalAddr,
 2938:                                  port   => 0},
 2939:                     do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(SockAddr, Config)
 2940:             end).
 2941: 
 2942: 
 2943: do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(#{family := _Fam} = SockAddr, _) ->
 2944:     %% Create the server
 2945:     Self   = self(),
 2946:     ?P("~n      SockAddr: ~p", [SockAddr]),
 2947:     ServerF = fun() ->
 2948:                       ?P("[server] try create socket"),
 2949:                       Sock =
 2950:                           try gen_udp:open(0, [{ifaddr, SockAddr},
 2951:                                                {active, true},
 2952:                                                binary]) of
 2953:                               {ok, S} ->
 2954:                                   S;
 2955:                               {error, OReason} ->
 2956:                                   ?P("[server] open error: "
 2957:                                      "~n      Reason: ~p", [OReason]),
 2958:                                   exit({open_error, OReason})
 2959:                           catch
 2960:                               OC:OE:OS ->
 2961:                                   ?P("[server] open failure: "
 2962:                                      "~n      Error Class: ~p"
 2963:                                      "~n      Error:       ~p"
 2964:                                      "~n      Call Stack:  ~p", [OC, OE, OS]),
 2965:                                   exit({open_failure, {OC, OE, OS}})
 2966:                           end,
 2967:                       ?P("[server] try get port"),
 2968:                       {ok, Port}  = inet:port(Sock),
 2969:                       ?P("[server] port: ~w", [Port]),
 2970:                       Self ! {{port, Port}, self()},
 2971: 
 2972: 
 2973:                       %% --- message sequance 1 ---
 2974: 
 2975:                       ?P("[server] await message 1"),
 2976:                       {CIP, CPort} =
 2977:                           receive
 2978:                               {udp, Sock, CIP1, CPort1, <<"hej">>} ->
 2979:                                   ?P("[server] received expected message 1 - "
 2980:                                      "connect to *this* client"),
 2981:                                   ok = gen_udp:connect(Sock, CIP1, CPort1),
 2982:                                   ?P("[server] send reply"),
 2983:                                   case gen_udp:send(Sock, "hopp") of
 2984:                                       ok -> 
 2985:                                           {CIP1, CPort1};
 2986:                                       {error, ehostunreach = Reason1} ->
 2987:                                           ?P("[server] send failed: ~p",
 2988:                                              [Reason1]),
 2989:                                           exit({skip, Reason1});
 2990:                                       {error, enetunreach = Reason1} ->
 2991:                                           ?P("[server] send failed: ~p",
 2992:                                              [Reason1]),
 2993:                                           exit({skip, Reason1});
 2994:                                       {error, Reason1} ->
 2995:                                           exit({send_failed, Reason1})
 2996:                                   end
 2997:                           after 5000 ->
 2998:                                   ?P("[server] receive (1) timeout:"
 2999:                                      "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 3000:                                   exit(receive_timeout)
 3001:                           end,
 3002: 
 3003: 
 3004:                       %% --- message sequance 2 ---
 3005: 
 3006:                       ?P("[server] await message 2"),
 3007:                       receive
 3008:                           {udp, Sock, CIP2, CPort2, <<"hej">>}
 3009:                             when (CIP2 =:= CIP) andalso (CPort2 =:= CPort) ->
 3010:                               ?P("[server] received expected message 2 - "
 3011:                                  "send reply"),
 3012:                               case gen_udp:send(Sock, "hopp") of
 3013:                                   ok -> 
 3014:                                       ok;
 3015:                                   {error, ehostunreach = Reason2} ->
 3016:                                       ?P("[server] send failed: ~p",
 3017:                                          [Reason2]),
 3018:                                       exit({skip, Reason2});
 3019:                                   {error, enetunreach = Reason2} ->
 3020:                                       ?P("[server] send failed: ~p",
 3021:                                          [Reason2]),
 3022:                                       exit({skip, Reason2});
 3023:                                   {error, Reason2} ->
 3024:                                       exit({send_failed, Reason2})
 3025:                               end
 3026:                       after 5000 ->
 3027:                               ?P("[server] receive (2) timeout:"
 3028:                                  "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 3029:                               exit(receive_timeout)
 3030:                       end,
 3031: 
 3032: 
 3033:                       %% --- message sequance 3 ---
 3034: 
 3035:                       ?P("[server] await message 3"),
 3036:                       receive
 3037:                           {udp, Sock, CIP3, CPort3, <<"hej">>}
 3038:                             when (CIP3 =:= CIP) andalso (CPort3 =:= CPort) ->
 3039:                               ?P("[server] received expected message 3 - "
 3040:                                  "send reply"),
 3041:                               ok = gen_udp:send(Sock, "hopp")
 3042:                       after 5000 ->
 3043:                               ?P("[server] receive (3) timeout:"
 3044:                                  "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 3045:                               exit(receive_timeout)
 3046:                       end,
 3047: 
 3048: 
 3049:                       %% --- message sequance 4 ---
 3050: 
 3051:                       ?P("[server] await message 4 - should be none!"),
 3052:                       receive
 3053:                           {udp, Sock, CIP4, CPort4, <<"hej">>} ->
 3054:                               ?P("[server] received unexpected message 4:"
 3055:                                  "~n      Address: ~p"
 3056:                                  "~n      Port:    ~p", [CIP4, CPort4]),
 3057:                               exit({unexpected_message, CIP4, CPort4})
 3058:                       after
 3059:                           1000 ->
 3060:                               ?P("Received nothing - expected"),
 3061:                               Self ! {nothing, self()}
 3062:                       end,
 3063: 
 3064:                       ?P("[server] await termination command"),
 3065:                       receive
 3066:                           {die, Self} ->
 3067:                               ?P("[server] terminating"),
 3068:                               (catch gen_udp:close(Sock)),
 3069:                               exit(normal)
 3070:                       end
 3071:               end,
 3072:     ?P("try start server"),
 3073:     Server = spawn_link(ServerF),
 3074:     ?P("server started - await port "),
 3075:     ServerPort = receive
 3076:                      {{port, Port}, Server} ->
 3077:                          Port;
 3078:                      {'EXIT', Server, Reason} ->
 3079:                          ?P("server died unexpectedly: "
 3080:                             "~n      ~p", [Reason]),
 3081:                          exit({unexpected_server_failure, Reason})
 3082:                  end,
 3083:     ?P("server port received: ~p", [ServerPort]),
 3084:     
 3085:     ?P("try connect to server"),
 3086:     ServerSockAddr = SockAddr#{port => ServerPort},
 3087:     {ok, CSock1} = gen_udp:open(0,
 3088:                                 [{ifaddr, SockAddr},
 3089:                                  {active, true},
 3090:                                  binary]),
 3091:     {ok, CSock2} = gen_udp:open(0,
 3092:                                 [{ifaddr, SockAddr},
 3093:                                  {active, true},
 3094:                                  binary]),
 3095:     ?P("client socket: "
 3096:        "~n      CSock 1: ~p"
 3097:        "~n      CPort 1: ~p"
 3098:        "~n      CSock 2: ~p"
 3099:        "~n      CPort 2: ~p",
 3100:        [CSock1, inet:port(CSock1), CSock2, inet:port(CSock2)]),
 3101: 
 3102: 
 3103:     %% --- message sequance 1 ---
 3104: 
 3105:     ?P("[csock 1] try (trad = address and port) send message 1"),
 3106:     case gen_udp:send(CSock1, maps:get(addr, SockAddr), ServerPort, "hej") of
 3107:         ok ->
 3108:             ok;
 3109:         {error, ehostunreach = Reason1} ->
 3110:             ?SKIPT(?F("send (1,1) failed: ~p", [Reason1]));
 3111:         {error, Reason1} ->
 3112:             ct:fail({send_failed, Reason1})
 3113:     end,
 3114:                  
 3115: 
 3116:     ?P("[csock 1] await reply message 1"),
 3117:     receive
 3118:         {udp, CSock1, _, _, <<"hopp">>} ->
 3119:             ?P("[csock 1] received expected reply message 1"),
 3120:             ok;
 3121: 
 3122:         {'EXIT', Server, {skip, SReason1}} ->
 3123:             ?P("received unexpected server skip exit (1):"
 3124:                "~n      ~p", [SReason1]),
 3125:             ?SKIPT(?F("server send (1,1) failed: ~p", [SReason1]));
 3126: 
 3127:         {'EXIT', Server, SReason1} ->
 3128:             ?P("received unexpected server exit (1):"
 3129:                "~n      ~p", [SReason1]),
 3130:             ct:fail({unexpected_server_exit, 1, SReason1})
 3131: 
 3132:     after 5000 ->
 3133:             ?P("receive (1) timeout:"
 3134:                "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 3135:             ct:fail(receive_timeout)
 3136:     end,
 3137: 
 3138: 
 3139:     %% --- message sequance 2 ---
 3140: 
 3141:     ?P("[csock 1] try (sockaddr) send message 2"),
 3142:     %% DstSockAddr = #{family => maps:get(family, SockAddr),
 3143:     %%                 addr   => maps:get(addr, SockAddr),
 3144:     %%                 port   => ServerPort},
 3145:     DstSockAddr = ServerSockAddr,
 3146:     case gen_udp:send(CSock1, DstSockAddr, "hej") of
 3147:         ok ->
 3148:             ok;
 3149:         {error, ehostunreach = Reason2} ->
 3150:             ?SKIPT(?F("send (1,2) failed: ~p", [Reason2]));
 3151:         {error, Reason2} ->
 3152:             ct:fail({send_failed, Reason2})
 3153:     end,
 3154:         
 3155: 
 3156:     ?P("[csock 1] await reply message 2"),
 3157:     receive
 3158:         {udp, CSock1, _, _, <<"hopp">>} ->
 3159:             ?P("[csock 1] received expected reply message 2"),
 3160:             ok;
 3161: 
 3162:         {'EXIT', Server, {skip, SReason2}} ->
 3163:             ?P("received unexpected server skip exit (2):"
 3164:                "~n      ~p", [SReason2]),
 3165:             ?SKIPT(?F("server send (1,2) failed: ~p", [SReason2]));
 3166: 
 3167:         {'EXIT', Server, SReason2} ->
 3168:             ?P("received unexpected server exit (2):"
 3169:                "~n.     ~p", [SReason2]),
 3170:             ct:fail({unexpected_server_exit, 2, SReason2})
 3171: 
 3172:     after 5000 ->
 3173:             ?P("[csock 1] receive (2) timeout:"
 3174:                "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 3175:             ct:fail(receive_timeout)
 3176:     end,
 3177: 
 3178: 
 3179:     %% --- message sequance 3 ---
 3180: 
 3181:     ?P("[csock 1] try connect to: "
 3182:        "~n      ~p", [ServerSockAddr]),
 3183:     ok = gen_udp:connect(CSock1, DstSockAddr),
 3184: 
 3185:     ?P("[csock 1] try send message 3"),
 3186:     ok = gen_udp:send(CSock1, "hej"),
 3187: 
 3188:     ?P("[csock 1] await reply message 3"),
 3189:     receive
 3190:         {udp, CSock1, _, _, <<"hopp">>} ->
 3191:             ?P("received expected reply message 3"),
 3192:             ok;
 3193: 
 3194:         {'EXIT', Server, SReason3} ->
 3195:             ?P("received unexpected server exit (3):"
 3196:                "~n.     ~p", [SReason3]),
 3197:             ct:fail({unexpected_server_exit, 3, SReason3})
 3198: 
 3199:     after 5000 ->
 3200:             ?P("[csock 1] receive (2) timeout:"
 3201:                "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 3202:             ct:fail(receive_timeout)
 3203: 
 3204:     end,
 3205: 
 3206: 
 3207:     %% --- message sequance 4 ---
 3208: 
 3209:     ?P("[csock 2] try (sockaddr) send message 4"),
 3210:     ok = gen_udp:send(CSock2, DstSockAddr, "hej"),
 3211: 
 3212:     ?P("[csock 2] await reply message 4 - expect failure"),
 3213:     receive
 3214:         {udp, CSock2, _, _, <<"hopp">>} ->
 3215:             ?P("[csock 2] received unexpected reply message 4"),
 3216:             exit(received_unexpected_message);
 3217:         {nothing, Server} ->
 3218:             ?P("[csock 2] server received nothing - expected"),
 3219:             ok
 3220:     end,
 3221: 
 3222: 
 3223:     ?P("terminate server"),
 3224:     Server ! {die, self()},
 3225: 
 3226:     ?P("await server termination"),
 3227:     receive
 3228:         {'EXIT', Server, normal} ->
 3229:             ok
 3230:     end,
 3231:     
 3232:     ?P("cleanup"),
 3233:     (catch gen_udp:close(CSock1)),
 3234:     (catch gen_udp:close(CSock2)),
 3235: 
 3236:     ?P("done"),
 3237:     ok.
 3238: 
 3239:     
 3240: 
 3241: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3242: 
 3243: %% Verify that the options [add|drop]_membership do not mess up
 3244: %% the options (including 'ip' which could not be added *after*).
 3245: %% This just attempts to very that the option processing is ok.
 3246: otp_18323_opts_processing(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3247:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 3248:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_otp_18323_opts_processing(Config) end).
 3249: 
 3250: do_otp_18323_opts_processing(_Config) ->
 3251:     ?P("begin"),
 3252: 
 3253:     do_otp_18323_opts_processing_verify(
 3254:       {add_membership,  {{239,1,2,3},{0,0,0,0}}}),
 3255: 
 3256:     do_otp_18323_opts_processing_verify(
 3257:       {drop_membership, {{239,1,2,3},{0,0,0,0}}}),
 3258: 
 3259:     ?P("done"),
 3260:     ok.
 3261: 
 3262: do_otp_18323_opts_processing_verify(MembershipOpt) ->
 3263:     Port   = 4321,
 3264:     RecBuf = 123456,
 3265:     Active = 10,
 3266:     IP     = {1,2,3,4},
 3267:     Opts   = [binary, MembershipOpt, {ip, IP}, {active, Active}],
 3268: 
 3269:     case inet:udp_options([{port, Port}, {recbuf, RecBuf} | Opts], inet_udp) of
 3270:         {ok, #udp_opts{ifaddr = IP,
 3271:                        port   = Port,
 3272:                        opts   = SockOpts}} ->
 3273:             ?P("Processed Socket Options: "
 3274:                "~n   IfAddr:    ~p"
 3275:                "~n   Port:      ~p"
 3276:                "~n   Sock Opts: ~p", [IP, Port, SockOpts]),
 3277:             %% Check that the recbuf and mode options are as expected
 3278:             %% The option 'binary' is shorthand for {mode, binary}
 3279:             {value, {recbuf, RecBuf}} = lists:keysearch(recbuf, 1, SockOpts),
 3280:             {value, {mode,   binary}} = lists:keysearch(mode,   1, SockOpts),
 3281:             {value, {active, Active}} = lists:keysearch(active, 1, SockOpts),
 3282:             ok;
 3283:         {error, Reason} ->
 3284:             exit(?F("Failed processing options: ~p", [Reason]))
 3285:     end.
 3286: 
 3287: 
 3288: 
 3289: 
 3290: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3291: 
 3292: %% Verify that the options [add|drop]_membership do not mess up
 3293: %% the options (including 'ip' which could not be added *after*).
 3294: otp_18323_open(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3295:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 3296:     Pre  = fun() ->
 3297:                    {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
 3298:                    #{local_addr => Addr}
 3299:            end,
 3300:     Case = fun(State) -> do_otp_18323_open(State) end,
 3301:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 3302:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Pre, Case, Post).
 3303: 
 3304: do_otp_18323_open(#{local_addr := Addr}) ->
 3305:     ?P("begin"),
 3306: 
 3307:     ROpts = [binary,
 3308:              {add_membership, {Addr,{0,0,0,0}}},
 3309:              {ip, Addr},
 3310:              {active,false},
 3311:              {debug, true}],
 3312:     SOpts = [{reuseaddr, true}, binary],
 3313: 
 3314:     ?P("create received socket"),
 3315:     {ok, R}     = gen_udp:open(0, ROpts),
 3316:     ?P("extract received socket port"),
 3317:     {ok, RPort} = inet:port(R),
 3318: 
 3319:     ?P("create sender socket"),
 3320:     {ok, S} = gen_udp:open(0, SOpts),
 3321: 
 3322:     ?P("send to receiver (at port ~w)", [RPort]),
 3323:     ok = gen_udp:send(S, Addr, RPort, <<"aaaaa">>),
 3324: 
 3325:     ?P("attempt to receive data on specified format binary)"),
 3326:     {ok, {_,_,<<"aaaaa">>}} = gen_udp:recv(R, 0, 200),
 3327: 
 3328:     ?P("done"),
 3329:     ok.
 3330: 
 3331: 
 3332: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3333: 
 3334: %% On some linux platforms, mostly in "docker"-like environments,
 3335: %% send *can* block. This, I think, mostly depends the value of
 3336: %% system config *net.unix.max_dgram_qlen*. On Docker this can
 3337: %% be small (10). With "normal" machines this is much larger (> 500),
 3338: %% which makes this hard tp reproduce.
 3339: otp_19332(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3340:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 3341:     Cond = fun() ->
 3342:                    is_linux(),
 3343:                    is_docker(Config),
 3344:                    %% We should really test for UDS support also,
 3345:                    %% but how without using 'socket'?
 3346:                    %% Maybe its enough to open the socket (with 'local').
 3347:                    has_small_enough_dgram_qlen(20),
 3348:                    ok
 3349:            end,
 3350:     Pre  = fun() ->
 3351:                    Opts = [local,
 3352:                            {active, false},
 3353:                            {debug, true}],
 3354:                    case gen_udp:open(0, Opts) of
 3355:                        {ok, Sock} ->
 3356:                            inet:setopts(Sock, [{debug, false}]),
 3357:                            #{sock => Sock};
 3358:                        {error, Reason} ->
 3359:                            skip(?F("Failed open socket: ~p", [Reason]))
 3360:                    end
 3361:            end,
 3362:     Case = fun(State) -> do_otp_19332(State) end,
 3363:     Post = fun(#{sock := Sock}) ->
 3364:                    (catch gen_udp:close(Sock))
 3365:            end,
 3366:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 3367: 
 3368: do_otp_19332(#{sock := Sock}) ->
 3369:     ?P("begin"),
 3370: 
 3371:     0 = do_otp_19332_test(Sock),
 3372: 
 3373:     ?P("done"),
 3374:     ok.
 3375: 
 3376: do_otp_19332_test(S) ->
 3377:     do_otp_19332_test(S, 100000, #{}, 0).
 3378: 
 3379: do_otp_19332_test(_S, 0, Errs, NumR) ->
 3380:     ?P("send attempts done: "
 3381:        "~n   Errors:                   ~p"
 3382:        "~n   Number of (inet) replies: ~p", [Errs, NumR]),
 3383:     NumR;
 3384: do_otp_19332_test(S, N, Errs, NumR) ->
 3385:     Packet = lists:duplicate(100, "hello\n"),
 3386:     Errs2  =
 3387:         case gen_udp:send(S, {local, "/tmp/test.sock"}, Packet) of
 3388:             ok ->
 3389:                 ?P("UNEXPECTED SUCCESS (at ~w)", [N]),
 3390:                 exit(unexpected_success);
 3391:             {error, Reason} ->
 3392:                 case Errs of
 3393:                     #{Reason := EN} ->
 3394:                         Errs#{Reason => EN + 1};
 3395:                     _ ->
 3396:                         Errs#{Reason => 1}
 3397:                 end
 3398:         end,
 3399:     receive
 3400:         {inet_reply, S, _Ref} ->
 3401:             ?P("Got a reply"),
 3402:             do_otp_19332_test(S, N-1, Errs2, NumR+1)
 3403:     after 0 ->
 3404:             do_otp_19332_test(S, N-1, Errs2, NumR)
 3405:     end.
 3406:     
 3407: 
 3408: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3409: 
 3410: otp_19357_open_with_ipv6_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3411:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 3412:     Cond = fun() ->
 3413:                    ?P("cond check: do we support socket"),
 3414:                    case ?LIB:is_socket_supported() of
 3415:                        true ->
 3416:                            ?P("cond check: do we support ipv6"),
 3417:                            ?LIB:has_support_ipv6();
 3418:                        false ->
 3419:                            ?SKIPT("SOCKET not supported")
 3420:                    end
 3421:            end,
 3422:     Pre  = fun() ->
 3423:                    {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet6),
 3424:                    #{local_addr => Addr}
 3425:            end,
 3426:     Case = fun(State) -> do_otp_19357_open_with_ipv6_option(State) end,
 3427:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 3428:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 3429: 
 3430: do_otp_19357_open_with_ipv6_option(#{local_addr := Addr}) ->
 3431:     %% First without specifying the (bind) address:
 3432:     TryOpen = fun(No, Opts) ->
 3433:                       try gen_udp:open(0, Opts) of
 3434:                           {ok, Sock} ->
 3435:                               ?P("success ~w", [No]),
 3436:                               (catch gen_udp:close(Sock));
 3437:                           {error, Reason} ->
 3438:                               ?P("FAILED open socket ~w: "
 3439:                                  "~n   ~p", [No, Reason]),
 3440:                               exit({Reason, No})
 3441:                       catch
 3442:                           C:E ->
 3443:                               ?P("CATCHED open socket ~w: "
 3444:                                  "~n   Error Class: ~p"
 3445:                                  "~n   Error:       ~p"
 3446:                                  "~n   ~p", [No, C, E]),
 3447:                               exit({C, E, No, Opts})
 3448:                       end
 3449:               end,
 3450:     ?P("try wo address (1)"),
 3451:     TryOpen(1, [{inet_backend, socket},
 3452:                 binary,
 3453:                 inet6, {ipv6_v6only, true},
 3454:                 {reuseaddr, true}]),
 3455: 
 3456:     ?P("try w address (2)"),
 3457:     TryOpen(2, [{inet_backend, socket},
 3458:                 binary,
 3459:                 inet6, {ipv6_v6only, true},
 3460:                 {ip, Addr},
 3461:                 {reuseaddr, true}]),
 3462: 
 3463:     ?P("done"),
 3464:     ok.
 3465: 
 3466: 
 3467: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3468: 
 3469: ok({ok,V}) -> V;
 3470: ok(NotOk) ->
 3471:     try throw(not_ok)
 3472:     catch
 3473: 	throw:not_ok:Stacktrace ->
 3474: 	    raise_error({not_ok, NotOk}, tl(Stacktrace))
 3475:     end.
 3476: 
 3477: raise_error(Reason, Stacktrace) ->
 3478:     erlang:raise(error, Reason, Stacktrace).
 3479: 
 3480: local_filename(Tag) ->
 3481:     "/tmp/" ?MODULE_STRING "_" ++ os:getpid() ++ "_" ++ atom_to_list(Tag).
 3482: 
 3483: bin_filename(String) ->
 3484:     unicode:characters_to_binary(String, file:native_name_encoding()).
 3485: 
 3486: delete_local_filenames() ->
 3487:     _ =
 3488: 	[file:delete(F) ||
 3489: 	    F <-
 3490: 		filelib:wildcard(
 3491: 		  "/tmp/" ?MODULE_STRING "_" ++ os:getpid() ++ "_*")],
 3492:     ok.
 3493: 
 3494: get_localaddr() ->
 3495:     get_localaddr(["localhost", "localhost6", "ip6-localhost"]).
 3496: 
 3497: get_localaddr([]) ->
 3498:     {error, localaddr_not_found};
 3499: get_localaddr([Localhost|Ls]) ->
 3500:     case inet:getaddr(Localhost, inet6) of
 3501:        {ok, LocalAddr} ->
 3502:            ?P("found local address: ~s ~p", [Localhost, LocalAddr]),
 3503:            {ok, LocalAddr};
 3504:        _ ->
 3505:            get_localaddr(Ls)
 3506:     end.
 3507: 
 3508: 
 3509: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3510: 
 3511: is_docker(Config) ->
 3512:     case which_label(Config) of
 3513:         {ok, docker} ->
 3514:             ok;
 3515:         _ ->
 3516:             skip("Is not running in a Docker")
 3517:     end.
 3518: 
 3519: has_small_enough_dgram_qlen(Max) when is_integer(Max) ->
 3520:     case max_dgram_qlen() of
 3521:         QLen when is_integer(QLen) andalso (QLen < Max) ->
 3522:             ok;
 3523:         QLen when is_integer(QLen) ->
 3524:             skip("QLen too large: " ++
 3525:                      integer_to_list(QLen) ++ " > " ++ integer_to_list(Max));
 3526:         _ ->
 3527:             skip("Could not get qlen")
 3528:     end.
 3529: 
 3530: -define(QLEN, "net.unix.max_dgram_qlen").
 3531: max_dgram_qlen() ->
 3532:     case string:strip(sysctl(?QLEN), right, $\n) of
 3533:         "sysctl: " ++ _ ->
 3534:             %% Key does not exist...skip
 3535:             skip;
 3536:         QLenAttrStr ->
 3537:             case [string:strip(S) || S <- string:tokens(QLenAttrStr, [$=])] of
 3538:                 [?QLEN, Value] ->
 3539:                     ?P("Max DGram QLen: ~p~n", [Value]),
 3540:                     try list_to_integer(Value) of
 3541:                         QLen ->
 3542:                             QLen
 3543:                     catch
 3544:                         _:_:_ ->
 3545:                             skip
 3546:                     end;
 3547:                 _ ->
 3548:                     skip
 3549:             end
 3550:     end.
 3551:     
 3552: sysctl(Key) when is_list(Key) ->
 3553:     os:cmd(?F("~w ~s", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Key])).
 3554: 
 3555: is_net_supported() ->
 3556:     try net:info() of
 3557:         #{} ->
 3558:             ok
 3559:     catch
 3560:         error : notsup ->
 3561:             not_supported(net)
 3562:     end.
 3563: 
 3564: -define(UNIX(Flavor), {unix, Flavor}).
 3565: 
 3566: is_linux() ->
 3567:     is_platform(?UNIX(linux), "Linux").
 3568: 
 3569: is_platform(Platform, PlatformStr) ->
 3570:     case os:type() of
 3571:         Platform ->
 3572:             ok;
 3573:         _ ->
 3574:             skip("Is not " ++ PlatformStr)
 3575:     end.
 3576: 
 3577: is_not_darwin() ->
 3578:     is_not_platform(darwin, "Darwin").
 3579: 
 3580: is_not_windows() ->
 3581:     is_not_platform(win32, "Windows").
 3582: 
 3583: is_not_platform(Platform, PlatformStr)
 3584:   when is_atom(Platform) andalso is_list(PlatformStr) ->
 3585:       case os:type() of
 3586:         {unix, Platform} ->
 3587:             skip("This does not work on " ++ PlatformStr);
 3588:         {win32, nt} when (Platform =:= win32) ->
 3589:             skip("This does not work on " ++ PlatformStr);
 3590:         _ ->
 3591:             ok
 3592:     end.
 3593: 
 3594: 
 3595: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3596: 
 3597: which_label(Config) ->
 3598:     config_lookup(label, Config).
 3599: 
 3600: config_lookup(Key, Config) ->
 3601:     case lists:keysearch(Key, 1, Config) of
 3602:         {value, {Key, Value}} ->
 3603:             {ok, Value};
 3604:         _ ->
 3605:             {error, not_found}
 3606:     end.
 3607: 
 3608: 
 3609: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3610: 
 3611: not_supported(What) ->
 3612:     skip({not_supported, What}).
 3613: 
 3614: skip(Reason) ->
 3615:     throw({skip, Reason}).
 3616: 
 3617: 
 3618: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3619: 
 3620: %% This is a simplified os:type()
 3621: which_os() ->
 3622:     %% Need this for the error handling
 3623:     case os:type() of
 3624:         {unix, Flavor} ->
 3625:             Flavor;
 3626:         {win32, nt} ->
 3627:             windows;
 3628:         _ ->
 3629:             other % We do not really care...
 3630:     end.
 3631: 
 3632: 
 3633: which_info(Sock) ->
 3634:     which_info([istate, active], inet:info(Sock), #{}).
 3635: 
 3636: which_info([], _Info, Acc) ->
 3637:     Acc;
 3638: which_info([Key|Keys], Info, Acc) ->
 3639:     case maps:find(Key, Info) of
 3640:         {ok, Value} ->
 3641:             which_info(Keys, Info, Acc#{Key => Value});
 3642:         error ->
 3643:             which_info(Keys, Info, Acc)
 3644:     end.
 3645: 
 3646: 
 3647: mq() ->
 3648:     pi(messages).
 3649: 
 3650: pi(Item) ->
 3651:     {Item, Val} = process_info(self(), Item),
 3652:     Val.
 3653:     
 3654:

 3656: 
 3657: start_node(Name) ->
 3658:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 3659:     ?START_NODE(Name, "-pa " ++ Pa).
 3660: 
 3661: 
 3662: stop_node(Node) ->
 3663:     ?STOP_NODE(Node).
 3664:

 3672: open_failed_str(Reason) ->
 3673:     ?F("Open failed: ~w", [Reason]).
